info.description:
This document is a comprehensive API specification for the Flussonic Media Server.

The Flussonic Media Server API lets you manage the server configuration: retrieving the information about the streams, DVRs, templates, etc., 
creating/updating, and removing them.
To know more about our API's design principles, visit [Flussonic HTTP API](https://flussonic.com/doc/api/flussonic-http-api/) page.

Permanent [download link](https://flussonic.com/doc/api/reference.json) to JSON schema file.

This API Reference provides you with all the methods, fields, values, and endpoints currently accessible in Flussonic.

Before you proceed, read the following information:

* `server_config` represents the server configuration file. Our built-in config parser validates the configuration file structure 
according to this specification.
* Some API methods may send extra fields in responses, so your application must be ready to drop them;
* Do not rely on undocumented fields in the responses as we may modify them at any moment.
* In further updates of this document, some fields may become deprecated. Such fields will be scheduled for deletion with 
`x-delete-at` property with year and month, after which it will no longer exist.
info.title: Flussonic Media Server API

loglevel.description: The level of logging according to event importance. Several values separated by comma.

oneOf.title: None
oneOf.description: Logging disabled.

oneOf.title: Debug
oneOf.description: Messages of all types are logged.

oneOf.title: Info
oneOf.description: Log info messages.

oneOf.title: Notice
oneOf.description: Log notices.

oneOf.title: Warning
oneOf.description: Log warnings.

oneOf.title: Error
oneOf.description: Log errors.

oneOf.title: Alert
oneOf.description: Log alerts.

oneOf.title: Critical
oneOf.description: Log critical messages.

estimated_count.description: Estimated total number of records for the query (regardless of the cursors).

next.description:
Next cursor: a properly encoded equivalent of offset allowing to read the next bunch of items. 
More information can be found [here](https://flussonic.com/doc/api/flussonic-http-api/#limited-collections-access-cursors).

prev.description:
Previous cursor: a properly encoded equivalent of offset allowing to read the previous bunch of items. 
More information can be found [here](https://flussonic.com/doc/api/flussonic-http-api/#limited-collections-access-cursors).

timing.description: An object with a list of different timings measured during this API call.

id.description: a unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem

status.description: the HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value

code.description: an application-specific error code, expressed as a string value

title.description:
a short, human-readable summary of the problem that SHOULD NOT change from
occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization

source.description: an object containing references to the source of the error

pointer.description:
a JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document 
[e.g. `"/data"` for a primary data object, or `"/data/attributes/title"` for a specific attribute].

parameter.description: a string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error.

meta.description: a meta object containing non-standard meta-information about the error.

url.description:
*Flussonic* takes a thumbnail from the specified URL on each keyframe.
May reduce CPU usage on IP cameras.

enabled.description: Whether to generate thumbnails from the video stream.

sizes.description: What sizes will be used for thumbnails generation.

oneOf.description:
Configures thumbnails behaviour.
- true : 

    In case of Stream: 
      Thumbnails are created and stored in DVR during the recording. If thumbnail is requested then it will be returned from DVR.

    In case of VOD:
      Thumbnails are created and stored in VOD location at thumbnails folder during the VOD opening if they are not created yet.
      If VOD location is `readonly` then it will be used only for thumbnails searching. Nothing will be created and stored.  

      If thumbnail is requested then it will be returned from thumbnails folder in VOD location.

- false : thumbnails are not stored at all. If thumbnail is requested then 403 'Forbidden' error will be returned.
- ondemand : thumbnails are not stored at all. If thumbnail is requested then it will be generated from corresponding video frame.

oneOf.title: Preroll
oneOf.description: Path to the pre-roll video file (in VOD) to be shown before the main video.

oneOf.title: Midroll
oneOf.description: Path to the mid-roll video file (in VOD) to be shown during the video according to the ad markers.

oneOf.title: Play
oneOf.description: Some external app plays video from Media Server.

oneOf.title: Publish
oneOf.description: Some external app publishes video to Media Server.

oneOf.title: Ingest
oneOf.description: Media Server ingests video from some external source like IPTV, IP camera, etc.

oneOf.title: Push
oneOf.description: Media Server pushes video to some external app.

oneOf.title: Stream
oneOf.description:
The session that can be parent to any number of `play`, `publish`, `push`, or `ingest` sessions.
It is designed to group several sessions each corresponding to one input. 

The `stream` session doesn't have `parent_id`.

oneOf.title: Muxer
oneOf.description:
The session for video pushed as part of MPTS (Multi Program Transport Stream). 
Several inputs are monitored in one session.

oneOf.title: API
oneOf.description: Session initiated via API.

oneOf.title: Player
oneOf.description: The session opened in addition to `play` when Flussonic Player plays video from Media Server.

oneOf.title: Publisher
oneOf.description: The session opened in addition to `publish` when the video is published to Media Server by Flussonic Publisher.

oneOf.title: IP
oneOf.description: IP address

oneOf.title: Name
oneOf.description: Stream name

oneOf.title: Proto
oneOf.description: Protocol

oneOf.title: Token
oneOf.description: Token

id.description: Unique identifier (or UUID) of the session.

source_id.description: Unique ID of the session's source.

parent_id.description: ID of the parent session, used only for sessions with the stream/substream type

ip.description: IP address of the connected peer.

bytes.description: Number of bytes sent in the session.

proto.description: Protocol used for the data transmission in the session.

opened_at.description: The time when this session was created.

started_at.description: The time when the frames transmission started in the session.

updated_at.description: The time when the session was last updated.

closed_at.description: The time when the session was closed.

segments_container.description:
Media container used for this protocol.
For instance, HLS can go with MPEG-TS or fMP4 segments and DASH with big fMP4 or small CMAF segments.

ssl.description:
This flag indicates that TLS (SSL) was used to serve this session.
It may be either input (ingest, publish) or output (push, play) session, this flag will be
filled for any of them.

dvr.description: This flag indicates that this session was using DVR.

name.description: File used in the streaming session.

user_id.description: User ID provided by the Middleware authorization backend.

max_sessions.description: The maximum number of sessions allowed for the given `user_id` by the middleware authorization backend.

soft_limitation.description: The flag shows if the soft limitation mode is enabled for the sessions with the given `user_id`.

user_name.description: User-provided original stream/VOD name before the rewrite of a media [*aliaser*](https://flussonic.com/doc/video-playback/media-name-aliasing/).

referer.description: Referer HTTP header or its analog for other protocols.

query_string.description: Full query string for the initial request of the session.

current_time.description: The current time value of the playback session.

user_agent.description: Client's user agent for selected protocol.
user_agent.example: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML. like Gecko) Chrome/90.0.4430.72 Safari/537.36

playback.description: Playback type for which the HTTP headers apply.

protocols.description: Configuration to allow/forbid headers for various playback protocols.

headers.description: HTTP headers in name-value format for manifest requests.

segment_headers.description: HTTP headers in name-value format for segment requests.

frame_duration.description:
For video track, it is the time between the beginning of a frame and the beginning of the next frame.

This parameter is important for some protocols. Normally, frame duration is a difference between timestamps of two neighbouring frames.
However, sometimes (when the connection is broken) video breakups are possible.
As result, the delta between two consequent frame timestamps will not be equal to the frame duration.
This situation is considered as a frame gap and is handled differently across different protocols.

last_gop.description:
Last GOP size (expressed in number of frames).
This parameter is used to monitor the quality of encoding: normally, average GOP size should be equal to the last GOP size.
If this value is floating, this means that your transcoder is working in a flexible GOP size mode and some players may have problems. 
This is not acceptable by most ABR usecases and it will not pass DVB validation protocol.

avg_gop.description:
Average GOP size (expressed in number of frames) of the last 1000-2000 frames. 
This parameter is used to monitor the quality of encoding: normally, average GOP size should be equal to the last GOP size.
If this value is floating, this means that your transcoder is working in flexible GOP size mode and some players may have problems. 
This is not acceptable by most ABR usecases and it will not pass DVB validation protocol.

avg_fps.description:
Actual average FPS - the number of frames diplayed per second (calculated for the last 200 frames).
The higher FPS is, the smoother the video playback is. 
Usually, standard values of FPS for films and video are used in different countries (for example, in Russia and Europe it is 25 FPS).

content.description: Content of the track (audio, video, or text).

title.description: Human-readable localized title of the track.

codec.description: Codec of the track. Different codecs do **not** get the same track.

language.description: Language value of the track, if applicable.

bframes.description:
Average number of B-frames in a GOP. B-frames contain links to keyframes and P-frames before and after themselves.
B-frames help to compress the video. However, some players impose limitations on this number: usually no more than 2 B-frames are used.
This value also defines the GOP structure - the repeated pattern of frames after the keyframe: P, BP, BBP, BBBP, or BBBBP.
bframes.x-notice: calculated number of bframes for statistic

gop_size.description:
The number of frames in a group of pictures (GOP). 
The encoder will create all GOPs of an exactly identical size - as specified in this option.
A bigger GOP can be good for video compression but it can result in big zap-time (the duration of time between changing a channel and displaying a new channel.)

pid.description:
This parameter sets PIDs values for outgoing MPEG-TS streams. 
PID identifies separate data stream inside the multiplexed MPEG-TS stream. 
It is possible to set PID values for PMT, SDT, video, and audio tracks. 
Tracks are numbered starting from one. The code a1=123 sets a PID value for the first audio track. 

It is possible to set the base index for the tracks of a certain type using the 0 (zero) index. 
For example, t0=100 sets PID=101 for the first track, 102 for the second, and so on. 
Numbers can be given in decimal form (by default) or hexadecimal with 16# prefix.

length_size.description: The size of the length field for H264 bitstream without start codes.

width.description:
The picture width in pixels on the display where it will be played by a player.
If you need to insert a web-player into a web page, use this value for choosing the player size.

height.description:
The picture height in pixels on the display where it will be played by a player.
If you need to insert a web-player into a web page, use this value for choosing the player size.

fps.description:
Frame rate (frames per second) - the speed at which a sequence of images is displayed on a screen.
Higher frame rates capture more images per second, which makes for smoother video.
The standard frame rate for color television in the Phase Alternating Line (PAL) format is 25 fps.
The standard frame rate for color television in the National Television System Committee (NTSC) format is 29,97 fps
(a little bit lower than the original frame rate of black and white NTSC television, equal to 30 fps.)
If interlaced TV is used, two fields of each frame (with odd-numbered lines and with even-numbered lines) are displayed consequently,
but the frame rate is actually not doubled (50 half-frames are still equal to 25 original frames).

pix_fmt.description: The color model of the video.

num_refs_frames.description: The number of I-frames to be used for encoding.

sar_width.description: The first number in SAR - the ratio of the width of the display video representation to the width of the pixel representation.

sar_height.description: The second number in SAR - the ratio of the width of the display video representation to the width of the pixel representation.

pixel_width.description: The picture width in pixels of the original video before transcoding.

pixel_height.description: The picture width in pixels of the original video before transcoding.

level.description:
A set of constraints that indicate a degree of required decoder performance.
This parameter is used for compatibility with old devices.

profile.description:
A specific codec-dependent profile of the output video.
The profile allows to assume if the track can be played on a particular device.

sample_rate.description:
Sample rate, in hertz -
the number of samples per second taken from a continuous signal to make a discrete or digital signal.

name.description: Under what name the audio track will be displayed on the player.

flow_type.description: Whether it is a file with a finite start and end time or a live stream.

stream_id.x-notice: Will be used as ts_stream_id in mpegts
stream_id.description: The identifier of the transport stream for MPEG TS streams.

program_id.x-notice: Will be used as program id
program_id.description: The program ID for MPEG TS streams.

tracks.description: Information about available tracks (video, audio, or text).

duration.description: Duration of the media, if applicable.

async.description: Resample the input audio to the specified parameters, using the libswresample library (`aresample` option of `ffmpeg`).

input_sample_rate.description:
Audio input sample rate.
Usually, it is autodetected but in some cases, e.g., for HE-AAC coding, we cannot get it correctly, so define manually.

volume.description:
Output audio volume. The value can be specified in decibels (dB) or it can be an integer/float (3, 0.5, etc.).

If it is just an integer or a float, the output audio volume is calculated by this formula:

`output_volume = volume * input_volume`

If specified in decibels (dB), the output audio volume is calculated as follows:

`output_volume = input_volume +/- volume`

depending whether it is a positive (+9dB) or a negative value (-6dB).

By default it equals to 1 (the input audio volume).

split_channels.description: This option allows to split each audio track with multiple channels into several mono tracks.

preset.description:
A set of values that determine a certain encoding speed, which influences a compression ratio. 
A slower preset will provide better compression (compression is quality per file size).

profile.description: Limits the output to a specific H.264 profile.

level.description:
A set of constraints that indicate a degree of required decoder performance.
This parameter is used for compatibility with old devices.

size.description: Target size of the image and the strategy to achieve it.

logo.description:
The configuration of a logo "burned" into the video track.
The transcoder adds the logo before the video is resized as specified in the `size` option. 
This means that the logo can be visibly stretched if the size was changed significantly.

alogo.description:
The configuration of a logo added to the video track after the video was resized as specified in the `size` option.

This prevents the logo picture from stretching that might occur when the `logo` option is used. 
You will need to prepare and specify a separate file with a logo for each size of the resulting video track.

fps.description:
Frame rate (frames per second) - the speed at which a sequence of images is displayed on a screen.

Higher frame rates capture more images per second, which makes for smoother video.
The standard frame rate for color television in the Phase Alternating Line (PAL) format is 25 fps.
The standard frame rate for color television in the National Television System Committee (NTSC) format is 29,97 fps
(a little bit lower than the original frame rate of black and white NTSC television, equal to 30 fps.)
If interlaced TV is used, two fields of each frame (with odd-numbered lines and with even-numbered lines) are displayed consequently,
but the frame rate is actually not doubled (50 half-frames are still equal to 25 original frames).

refs.description:
The number of reference frames in a GOP.
Reference frames are frames of a compressed video that are used to define other frames (P-frames and B-frames).

gop.description:
Sets the number of frames in a GOP.
The encoder will create all GOPs of an exactly identical size - as specified in this option.

qp_range.description:
The ranges of the quantization parameter for different types of frames in a GOP.

Quantization is an algorithm used for video compression. It is based on fragmentation of video frames.
Increasing this parameter allows to improve the compression but may lower the picture quality.
Usually, these ranges are defined automatically by the transcoder, but for some types of transcoders it makes sense to set them manually.

threads.description:
Number of threads used by the decoder when transcoding with CPU (it is not used for other types of transcoder).
This parameter allows to increase performance by adding new threads. By default, it is autodetected.

open_gop.description:
Whether open GOP is used. Open GOP contains P-frames that refer to the frames before the keyframe.
It allows to decrease bitrate to 5-7%, but can result in breaking the picture.

interlace.description:
This parameter is used to get an interlaced stream from a progressive one.
The allowed values are `true` (interlaced video), `false` (progressive video), or one of the methods for producing interlaced video supported for the selected type of transcoder.

rc_method.description: A method for creating output video with constant bitrate suitable for broadcasting to television networks.

temporal_tradeoff.description:
Drop some frames in dynamic scenes when the transcoder does not have time to code all frames.
The allowed values are: 

* `15` - drop 1 from 5
* `13` - drop 1 from 3
* `12` - drop 1 from 2
* `23` - drop 2 from 3
* `0` - do not drop frames

vbv_bufsize.description: Virtual buffer size, it bits. The default value is `gop / fps * bitrate`.

resize_mode.description:
The mode to be used for resizing video tracks. It is one of the computing platforms for Flussonic Coder:

* vic -  Video Image Converter, specific for Jetson Nvidia
* cuda - CUDA (or Compute Unified Device Architecture)

burn.description: Configuration of burn-in text, timestamp, or subtitles to video frames.

oneOf.title: Keep
oneOf.description: Keep the original audio codec.

oneOf.title: AAC
oneOf.description: Keep AAC if available or transcode to AAC; delete other tracks if any.

oneOf.title: Add_AAC
oneOf.description: Add AAC if it was not available already while keeping the original track.

type.description: The type of the device used for transcoding.

id.description:
The ID of the device used for transcoding.

In PUT requests, you can use `auto` for Flussonic to set the ID itself. 
In the response to GET requests, the `id` will always be a number.

name.description: The name of the transcoder device.

can_logo.description: Shows if the device can put a logo on the image.

can_interlace.description: Shows if the device can make an interlaced stream from a progressive one.

can_internal.description: Shows if the transcoder with this device can run in the same process as Flussonic Media Server.

reconfig_support.description:
The ability of the device to be reconfigured online, i.e. without complete restart of the transcoder.

`full` means that both decoder and encoder can be reconfigured online.
`encoder` means that only encoder can be reconfigured online.
`decoder` means that only decoder can be reconfigured online.
`false` means that online reconfiguration is not supported.

oneOf.title: VBR
oneOf.description:
The encoder will not encode a stream to be DVB compliant.
However, VBR (Variable Bit Rate) produces better compression compared to CBR at about the same quality.

oneOf.title: CBR
oneOf.description:
The encoder will produce a DVB compliant stream.
The bitrate of the output stream will be stable to fit the fixed-bandwidth channel. 
In other words, we guarantee that the bitrate has a certain upper bound in a sliding window.

oneOf.title: CBR2pass
oneOf.description:
The encoder will encode the video once in CBR, 
then it will encode it second time in CBR but using the information from the previous pass to improve quality.

borderw.description: The width, in pixel, of the border to be drawn around the text, timestamp, or subtitles.

alpha.description: Box opacity (use values from 0.1 to 1.0, 0.0 - completely transparent, 1.0 - completely opaque).

file.description:
The subpath to the `.ttf` font file in the `font` subdirectory of the `/etc/flussonic/` directory. 
This means you can place the font file like `/etc/flussonic/font/SomeFont.ttf`.

If the font file specified is missing in `/etc/flussonic/font/`, the default `FiraCode-Regular.ttf` font will be used, which is included in Flussonic.

You can also specify the full path to a font file. Make sure you put the font file in the directory you specified.

alpha.description: Font opacity (use values from 0.1 to 1.0, 0.0 - completely transparent, 1.0 - completely opaque).

text.description:
Text, time, or subtitles to burn-in to video frames.

* For text - it is the text
* For subtitles - it is the subtitles track, e.g., `t1`.
* For time - it is the time in one of the formats:
** `%T` - the time in 24-hour notation (`%H:%M:%S`).
** `%F` - equivalent to `%Y-%m-%d` (the ISO 8601 date format).

x.description: The offset of the text, timestamp, or subtitles position, in pixel, to the right or left to the center of the screen.

y.description: The offset of the text, timestamp, or subtitles position, in pixel, up or down to the center of the screen.

position.description:
Position to burn text:
- `tl` : Top left
- `tr` : Top right
- `bl` : Bottom left
- `br` : Bottom right
- `c` : Center
- `ct` : Center top
- `cb` : Center bottom

font.description: Font to be used for text, timestamp, or subtitles burn-in to video frames.

box.description: Parameters of the box around the text, timestamp, or subtitles.

text.description: Configuration of burn-in text to video frames.

time.description: Configuration of burn-in timestamp to video frames.

sub.description: Configuration of burn-in subtitles to video frames.

hw.description: Transcoder hardware device type to be used for transcoding a stream.

deviceid.description: Identifier of hardware device to be used for transcoding a stream.

external.description:
If this parameter is se to `true` (by default), the transcoder runs in a separate process from Flussonic.

If it is set to `false`, the transcoder will run in the same process as Flussonic. 
This mode speeds up encoding, especially when encoding audio or when using an Nvidia device. 
However, a transcoder error may cause Flussonic to crash.

seamless.description:
Enable smooth, or seamless, source switching. 
In this case, the transcoder seamlessly switches to another source format without dropping any frames when the stream source or the media information has changed. 

For transcoding with CPU or Nvidia NVENC, seamless source switching is the default behavior.
However, for other hardware transcoders (Intel Quick Sync) it might be necessary to configure the seamless source switching.

gop.description:
GOP (group of pictures) size (in frames) to be applied for any video track in the stream.
The encoder will create all GOPs of an exactly identical size - as specified in this option.
May be overridden for a track.

burn.description: Configuration of text, timestamp or subtitles burn-in to video frames.

left.description: The `x` coordinate of the upper-left corner of the output video withing the input video.

top.description: The `y` coordinate of the upper-left corner of the output video withing the input video.

width.description: The width of the output video.

height.description: The height of the output video.

pix_fmt.description: The required pixel format according to a color model.

deinterlace.description:
Activate deinterlacing, i.e., converting an interlaced image to a progressive image. 
It is necessary for comfortable viewing of legacy TV video on PC/mobile devices. You can use the following values:

`true` - deinterlacing enabled
`false` - deinterlacing disabled
`adaptive` - use adaptive deinterlacing method
`yadif` - use CUDA yadif deinterlacing method

deinterlace_rate.description:
This parameter is used when encoding with Nvidia NVENC.
You can remove duplicate frames that were produced after deinterlacing, preventing increased bitrate, by one of two methods:

* `frame` - from field sequence `1a 1b 2a 2b 3a 3b` we get frame sequence `1a1b 2a2b 3a3b`. The FPS stays the same.
* `field` - fields `1a 1b 2a 2b 3a 3b` transform into `1a1b 1b2a 2a2b 2b3a` frames. The FPS increases two times after transcoding.

threads.description: Defines a number of threads in a decoder. One thread uses one core.

enable_audio_desync_comp.description: If this option is enabled, the missed audio frames are compensated by the silence.

dsurfaces.description:
This parameter is applicable for NVENC transcoder only.
It is the number of the buffers used by the decoder. A buffer allows to compensate different sizes of frames: 
if a frame is too big to be played in time with a specified FPS, the frames from the buffer are played.

The default value is 16.
You can specify a value from 4 to 48 depending of the video card memory.

gen_pts.description:
Enable generation of PTS (presentation time stamps) when using QSV transcoder.

If `gen_pts=no`, the PTS received from the decoder are used. 
In some cases, it could result in unsynced audio and video. 
So this parameter was implemented for better audio and video synchronization.

drop_frame_interval.description:
This parameter is applicable for NVIDIA Jetson transcoder only.
This is the number of frames after wich the decoder skips a frame and, thus, allows to save the resources. For example:

* 1 - sip each frame
* 2 - skip each second frame
* 3 - skip each third frame, etc.

This option can be useful for streams with high FPS (e.g., 60) as it allows to increase the bandwidth.

no_dpb.description:
Switch off the decoded picture buffer. Works for the streams with 1 reference frame.
The default value is `false`.

streaming_frame.description:
Allow receiving incomplete frames from the input buffer.
If it is set to `true`, the decoder can start decoding before the complete frame is received.

bitrate.description:
Audio bitrate. The allowed values are:

* `copy` - the bitrate or the original stream is copied to the outgoing stream.
* a full number of bits (e.g., 64000) or a short form of the number with `k` (e.g., 64k).

sample_rate.description:
Sample rate, in hertz - 
the number of samples per second taken from a continuous signal to make a discrete or digital signal.
The allowed values are: 
`0` - to copy input sample rate, a number (input audio is resampled with equalization), or the empty value (equalization without resampling)

codec.description: Audio codec (the AAC codec is used by default).

channels.description: The number of audio channels in an output stream.

async.description: Resample the input audio to the specified parameters, using the libswresample library (`aresample` option of `ffmpeg`).

air.description:
Audio input sample rate.
Usually, it is autodetected but in some cases, e.g., for HE-AAC coding, we cannot get it correctly, so define manually.

avol.description:
Output audio volume. The value can be specified in decibels (dB) or it can be an integer/float (3, 0.5, etc.).

If it is just an integer or a float, the output audio volume is calculated by this formula:

`output_volume = avol * input_volume`

If specified in decibels (dB), the output audio volume is calculated as follows:

`output_volume = input_volume +/- avol`

depending whether it is a positive (+9dB) or a negative value (-6dB).

By default it equals to 1 (the input audio volume).

split_channels.description: This option allows to split each audio track with multiple channels into several mono tracks.

width.description:
The picture width in pixels on the display where it will be played by a player.
If you need to insert a web-player into a web page, use this value for choosing the player size.

height.description:
The picture height in pixels on the display where it will be played by a player.
If you need to insert a web-player into a web page, use this value for choosing the player size.

strategy.description: The algorithm of the picture resizing: crop, scale, or fit.

background.description:
The color of the area in the player that is not occupied by the video after resizing. 
It is used only with the 'fit' strategy.

x.description: The first number in SAR - the ratio of the width of the display video representation to the width of the pixel representation.

y.description: The second number in SAR - the ratio of the width of the display video representation to the width of the pixel representation.

x.description: The offset of the logo position, in pixel, to the right or left to the center of the screen.

y.description: The offset of the logo position, in pixel, up or down to the center of the screen.

position.description:
Position to place the logo:
- `tl` : Top left
- `tr` : Top right
- `bl` : Bottom left
- `br` : Bottom right
- `c` : Center

bitrate.description: The bitrate of a video track.

preset.description:
A set of values that determine a certain encoding speed, which influences a compression ratio. 
A slower preset will provide better compression (compression is quality per file size).

profile.description: Limits the output to a specific H.264 profile.

level.description:
A set of constraints that indicate a degree of required decoder performance.
This parameter is used for compatibility with old devices.

size.description: Target size of the image and the strategy to achieve it.

logo.description:
The configuration of a logo "burned" into the video track.
The transcoder adds the logo before the video is resized as specified in the `size` option. 
This means that the logo can be visibly stretched if the size was changed significantly.

alogo.description:
The configuration of a logo added to the video track after the video was resized as specified in the `size` option.

This prevents the logo picture from stretching that might occur when the `logo` option is used. 
You will need to prepare and specify a separate file with a logo for each size of the resulting video track.

fps.description:
Frame rate (frames per second) - the speed at which a sequence of images is displayed on a screen.

Higher frame rates capture more images per second, which makes for smoother video.
The standard frame rate for color television in the Phase Alternating Line (PAL) format is 25 fps.
The standard frame rate for color television in the National Television System Committee (NTSC) format is 29,97 fps
(a little bit lower than the original frame rate of black and white NTSC television, equal to 30 fps.)
If interlaced TV is used, two fields of each frame (with odd-numbered lines and with even-numbered lines) are displayed consequently,
but the frame rate is actually not doubled (50 half-frames are still equal to 25 original frames).

bframes.description:
Number of B-frames in a GOP. B-frames contain links to keyframes and P-frames before and after themselves.
B-frames help to compress the video. However, some players impose limitations on this number: usually no more than 2 B-frames are used.
This value also defines the GOP structure - the repeated pattern of frames after the keyframe: P, BP, BBP, BBBP, or BBBBP.

When set to 0, this option disables b-frames. This may be necessary, for example, when broadcasting to RTSP.

refs.description:
The number of reference frames in a GOP.
Reference frames are frames of a compressed video that are used to define other frames (P-frames and B-frames).

gop.description:
Sets the number of frames in a GOP. 
The encoder will create all GOPs of an exactly identical size - as specified in this option.

qp_range.description:
The ranges of the quantization parameter for different types of frames in a GOP.

Quantization is an algorithm used for video compression. It is based on fragmentation of video frames.
Increasing this parameter allows to improve the compression but may lower the picture quality.
Usually, these ranges are defined automatically by the transcoder, but for some types of transcoders it makes sense to set them manually.

threads.description:
Number of threads used by the decoder when transcoding with CPU (it is not used for other types of transcoder).
This parameter allows to increase performance by adding new threads. By default, it is autodetected.

open_gop.description:
Whether open GOP is used. Open GOP contains P-frames that refer to the frames before the keyframe.
It allows to decrease bitrate to 5-7%, but can result in breaking the picture.

interlace.description:
This parameter is used to get an interlaced stream from a progressive one.
The allowed values are `true` (interlaced video), `false` (progressive video), or one of the methods for producing interlaced video supported for the selected type of transcoder.

rc_method.description: A method for creating output video with constant bitrate suitable for broadcasting to television networks.

temporal_tradeoff.description:
Drop some frames in dynamic scenes when the transcoder does not have time to code all frames.
The allowed values are: 

* `15` - drop 1 from 5
* `13` - drop 1 from 3
* `12` - drop 1 from 2
* `23` - drop 2 from 3
* `0` - do not drop frames

vbv_bufsize.description: Virtual buffer size, it bits. The default value is `gop / fps * bitrate`.

resize_mode.description:
The mode to be used for resizing video tracks. It is one of the computing platforms for Flussonic Coder:

* vic -  Video Image Converter, specific for Jetson Nvidia
* cuda - CUDA (or Compute Unified Device Architecture)

burn.description: Configuration of burn-in text, timestamp, or subtitles to video frames.

global.description: Transcoder settings to be used for transcoding.

decoder.description: Decoder settings to be used for transcoding.

audio.description: List of audio tracks the stream audio track will be transcoded into.

video.description: List of video tracks the stream video track will be transcoded into.

from.description: The beginning of the recorded DVR range.

duration.description: The duration of the recorded DVR range.

storage_limit.description:
Maximum disk consumption in bytes. When this limit is reached, 
the oldest segment of the recording will be overridden by later data.

disk_space.description: Maximum disk consumption in bytes. (Alias for `storage_limit`.)

disk_usage_limit.description:
Maximum disk consumption in percents. When this limit is reached, 
the oldest segment of the recording will be overridden by later data.

disk_limit.description: Maximum disk consumption in percents. (Alias for `disk_usage_limit`.)

expiration.description:
Archive depth - a period (in seconds) back from the current moment during which the archive is stored. 
As time goes, the parts of the recording which are older than the archive depth are being overridden by the later parts.

dvr_limit.description:
Archive depth - a period (in seconds) back from the current moment during which the archive is stored. 
(Alias for `expiration`.)

dvr_replicate.description:
Whether DVR replication is used. Replication means that a DVR archive is stored on two (or more) Flussonic servers.
It can be used for reliability or for broadcasting with a time shift. More information can be found [here](https://flussonic.com/doc/digital-video-recording-dvr/dvr-replication/).

replication_port.description:
Replication port. 
By default, replication is enabled on the port specified when configuring the M4F source. 
You can specify a separate port for replication.

schedule.description:
One or several time intervals for recording by schedule.
The beginning and the end of each interval are set in "hhmm" format (without leading zeros ) according to UTC standard. 
For example, `2330` is for 23:30, `800` - for 08:00. The interval can go over midnight, e.g. 22:00-1:30. In this case it is set as follows: `[2200,130]`.

Scheduled recording can be useful for the channels with part-time broadcasting. 
It allows to save disk space significantly.

dvr_offline.description:
If this option is enabled, Flussonic detects DVR at the start of the stream,
but does not start recording immediately and waits for external API request.

copy.description:
The URL of another storage to copy the blobs (hours of the archive) into. 
Copying is done when a blob is complete (i.e., once an hour), and therefore helps significantly reduce the number of network requests to a cloud storage.

keep_locks.description: Whether the locked DVR recordings will be kept when disk usage limit is reached (in bytes or percents).

root.description: A path where the DVR archive is stored.

raid.description:
This value is present if RAID (redundant array of independent disks) is enabled. More information can be found [here](https://flussonic.com/doc/digital-video-recording-dvr/flussonic-raid-for-dvr/). 
The allowed value is 0.

check_mount.description:
If this parameter is set to 'true' (by default), 
Flussonic will check if the disks were mounted properly before writing to them.

active.description: The number of disks to write the archive.

index.description: A directory on an SSD disk where the data will be cached.

disks.description: RAID disks mounted on the server.

path.description: The path to a mounted disk.

mode.description: The mode of using the disk. Read more about the modes [here](https://flussonic.com/doc/digital-video-recording-dvr/flussonic-raid-for-dvr/#raid-configuration-example-with-the-full-set-of-options).

stats.description:
The runtime statistics about RAID. The statistics shows the state of disks.
More information can be found [here](https://flussonic.com/doc/digital-video-recording-dvr/flussonic-raid-for-dvr/#reading-runtime-statistics)

disk.description: The path to a mounted disk.

path.description: A path where the DVR archive is stored.

mounted.description: Whether the disk is mounted correctly.

mode.description: The mode of using the disk. Read more about the modes [here](https://flussonic.com/doc/digital-video-recording-dvr/flussonic-raid-for-dvr/#raid-configuration-example-with-the-full-set-of-options).

blobs_count.description: The number of blobs on the disk.

size.description: The size of the disk in bytes.

migration_speed.description: The speed of copying the last blob, in bytes per second.

migration_eta.description: The estimated migration end time, in UTC seconds.

migration_updated.description: The time when the values of `migration_speed` and `migration_eta` were last updated.

root.description:
The path to the directory where the source will be recorded.

This parameter is related to the `record_unput` feature that allows recording the stream input as-is. 
Recommended for debugging needs **only**.

storage_limit.description:
Maximum disk consumption in bytes. When this limit is reached, 
the oldest segment of the recording will be overridden by later data.

expiration.description:
A period (in seconds) back from the current moment during which the files are stored.
As time goes, the files which are older than this period are being overridden by the later files.

disk_space.description:
Maximum disk consumption in bytes. 
When this limit is reached, the oldest files will be overridden by later files.

dvr_limit.description:
A period (in seconds) back from the current moment during which the files are stored.
As time goes, the files which are older than this period are being overridden by the later files.

path.description: The path where the files from the cloud or HTTP are cached to speed up broadcasting.

misses.description: The number of requests necessary for a file to be cached.

storage_limit.description:
Maximum disk consumption in bytes. 
When this limit is reached, the oldest files will be overridden by later files.

expiration.description:
A period (in seconds) back from the current moment during which the files are stored.
As time goes, the files which are older than this period are being overridden by the later files.

disk_limit.description: Maximum disk consumption. Replaced by `storage_limit` in newer versions.

time_limit.description: Segment expiration period. Replaced by `expiration` in newer versions.

page.description:
Page number of the teletext received from an SDI card.
It is defined according to ETS 300 706 teletext specification.

The information about the pages is received from the stream provider.

type.description: Teletext page type defined according to the Specification for Service Information (SI) in DVB systems, 6.2.32 Teletext descriptor in EN 300 468 Digital Video Broadcasting (DVB).

port.description:
Listening port or a `host:port` pair for the SRT configuration.
Must be unique on the whole server.

minversion.description:
The minimum SRT version that is required from the peer for SRT publication.
The format is `x.y.z`. 
The default value is `1.0.0`.

version.description:
Required SRT version. The format is `x.y.z`.
The default value is `1.0.0`.

enforcedencryption.description:
Whether both connection parties must have the same password set (including empty, in other words, with no encryption). 
If the passwords do not match or only one side is unencrypted, the connection is rejected. 
The default value is `true`.

passphrase.description:
The password for the encrypted transmission. 
Its length should be not less than 10 and not more than 79 characters. 
The default value is an empty string ("").

timeout.description:
Data transmission timeout in seconds. 
If set to `false` then data transmission time is unlimited. This is a defalut behavior.

linger.description:
The time, in seconds, that the socket waits for the unsent data before closing. 
The default value is 180.

reference.description: Stream can refer to the globally declared DVR. This option referres to a single DVR entry.

root.description: If no `reference` specified, then `root` must be specified. Video recording will be made to `root/name` directory.

pid.description:
This parameter sets PID to specify which track to include into output MPTS stream. 
Transponder will include only the tracks with specified PIDs.

It is possible to set PID values for video and audio tracks, as well as for PMT and SDT.

track.description: Number of the track set by Flussonic (usually, all video tracks and then all audio tracks are numbered starting from 1).

gpu.description: The number of a video card where video analytic is performed, starts from 0.

alg.description: The algorithm used for video analytics.

oneOf.description: The algorithm for face recognition is used.
The algorithm for license plate recognition is used (the default value).
The algorithm used only for tests, it produces an event each frame processed.

areas.description:
This parameter allows you to select specific polygonal area(s) to detect license plates (works only for `alg = plates`).
By default, it is empty and the recognition system searches for license plates over all the camera field of view.

Each area is specified as a sequence of comma-separated coordinates of vertices of the polygon: `x0,y0,x1,y1,x2,y2,...`.
The vertices are specified in a counter-clockwise direction. Multiple areas are separated by `:`.

url.description: The URL of an HTTP backend.

domains.description:
Specifying the domains, within which playing this video is allowed. 
This does not work for those clients that do not pass the value of Referer HTTP header.

max_sessions.description:
The maximal number of streams or files the user can view simultaneously.
This limitation allows to prevent users from full restreaming to their servers.

allowed_countries.description:
Explicit list of countries (two-letter country codes according to ISO 3166-1) that have access to the content without any other checks. 

Flussonic uses the MaxMind GeoLite2 Country database to map a country to a block of IP addresses. 
New releases of GeoIP2 databases come out more often than the releases of Flussonic server, so sometimes the used database can become outdated. 
Therefore we recommend you to install a separate GeoIP2 library and set up Flussonic to use it.

disallowed_countries.description:
Explicit list of countries (two-letter country codes according to ISO 3166-1) that are banned from accessing the content. 

Flussonic uses the MaxMind GeoLite2 Country database to map a country to a block of IP addresses. 
New releases of GeoIP2 databases come out more often than the releases of Flussonic server, so sometimes the used database can become outdated. 
Therefore we recommend you to install a separate GeoIP2 library and set up Flussonic to use it.

soft_limitation.description:
If this option is enabled and `max_sessions` limitation is used, the extra sessions are interrupted not immediately, but in 30 or 90 seconds.
This can be useful for middlewares that cannot generate a new token for every new stream or file request 
and therefore need time to understand that all sessions are being used.

session_keys.description:
A list of keys to generate a session ID value, allowing to configure the authorization scheme 
which is a hash sum calculated as follows: `hash(name + ip + proto)`.
This parameter allows to finish one session and start another one with the same authorization token.
The keys `name`,`ip`, and `proto` are required.

opened_at.description: The time when the stream opened before authorization/connection completed(in UTC milliseconds).

started_at.description: The time when the stream started after authorization/connection completed(in UTC milliseconds).

status.description: Indicates the status of the stream.

backup_running.description: Whether a backup is currently running.

dvr_enabled.description: If DVR is enabled for the stream.

dvr_info.description: The information about the recorded DVR archive.

dvr_replication.description:
If DVR replication is enabled for the stream.
Replication means that a DVR archive is stored on two (or more) Flussonic servers for reliability.

dvr_replication_running.description:
If DVR replication is in progress for the stream.
Replication means that a DVR archive is stored on two (or more) Flussonic servers for reliability.

last_dts.description: Last frame timestamp read from the stream.

last_dts_at.description: The time when the last time frame was sent to the stream output (in UTC).

media_info.description: Technical information about the output media content.

ts_delay.description: The time period during which no frames were received from the stream's input.

remote.x-notice: Used only for grouping the streams in UI.
remote.description: If the stream is not local, i.e. sourced from the remote server.

source_hostname.x-notice: Used only for grouping the streams in UI.

published_from.description: IP address of the source of publication to Flussonic.

published_via.description: The protocol used for publication to Flussonic.

source_error.description: Error code showing if there are any problems with capturing the stream.

input_error_rate.description: The number of packets dropped per second.

coder_error.description: Shows if there was any encoding error.

lifetime.description: The time period in seconds during which the stream is being captured.

retry_count.description: The number of attempts to restore the stream if `alive=false`.

client_count.description: The number of clients receiving the stream.

last_access_at.description: Date and time the stream was accessed the last time.

bytes_in.description: The amount of stream data received from the input.

bytes_out.description: The amount of stream data sent to the clients.

out_bandwidth.description: The output traffic of the stream.

current_agent_id.description: The identifier of the Agent that is currently serving the stream.

agent_status.description: The status of the Agent serving the stream.

running_transcoder.description: If the transcoder is enabled for the stream.

running.description: Shows if the stream is ready to be served to clients. Replaced with `status = running` in newer versions.

start_running_at.description: Date and time when `status = running` was set.

running_on.description: List of servers hostnames where the stream is running on.

oneOf.title: Running
oneOf.description: Input is OK, stream is ready to be served to your audience.

oneOf.title: Waiting
oneOf.description: Flussonic awaits for input (publish) or it's an 'on demand' stream waiting for client.

oneOf.title: Error
oneOf.description: Something is wrong and Flussonic is not able to serve the stream to your audience.

whitelist.description:
- If set to `True`, server **allows** a playback only for listed protocols;
- If set to `False`, server **forbids** a playback only for listed protocols;

hls.description: Whether to allow or deny an HLS stream playback, depending on the `whitelist` properties.

dash.description: Whether to allow or deny a DASH stream playback, depending on the `whitelist` properties.

player.description: Whether to allow or deny playback in embed.html, depending on the `whitelist` properties.

mss.description: Whether to allow or deny an MSS stream playback, depending on the `whitelist` properties.

rtmp.description: Whether to allow or deny an RTMP stream playback, depending on the `whitelist` properties.

rtsp.description: Whether to allow or deny an RTSP stream playback, depending on the `whitelist` properties.

m4f.description: Whether to allow or deny an M4F stream playback, depending on the `whitelist` properties.

m4s.description: Whether to allow or deny an M4S stream playback, depending on the `whitelist` properties.

mseld.description: Whether to allow or deny an MSE-LD stream playback, depending on the `whitelist` properties.

tshttp.description: Whether to allow or deny an MPEG-TS stream playback over HTTP(S), depending on the `whitelist` properties.

webrtc.description: Whether to allow or deny an WebRTC stream playback, depending on the `whitelist` properties.

srt.description: Whether to allow or deny an SRT stream playback, depending on the `whitelist` properties.

shoutcast.description: Whether to allow or deny a SHOUTcast/Icecast stream playback, depending on the `whitelist` properties.

mp4.description:
Whether to allow or deny an MP4 file download over HTTP(S), depending on the `whitelist` properties.
Used to export DVR segment(s) in MP4 file.

jpeg.description: Whether to allow or deny delivering JPEG thumbnails over HTTP(S), depending on the `whitelist` properties.

api.description: Whether to allow or deny API requests, depending on the `whitelist` properties.

stream_config_stripped.description:
This is a reduced configuration of stream that contains only actual used config.
Can compare it with stream_config that includes some runtime information and 
interpretation of stream config information, like config_on_disk

title.description:
Human-readable title of the stream. Provided for SDT MPEG-TS table or
SDP RTSP title parameter.

position.description: Position of the stream in order of streams in the config file, if declared.

named_by.description:
Where the stream is initialized: config, user play/publication, or remote
cluster server.

static.description:
Whether a stream is `static` or not. 
If set to `True` the server will try to keep this stream running even if
there are no viewers or errors encountered.

Streamer restarts *all* `static` streams even if any internal errors occur
and the `static` streams crash.

disabled.description:
Whether a stream is disabled. Disabled streams are inactive and do not run. 
Displayed only with the API calls.

inputs.description:
List of stream inputs. 
***Important:*** A stream without any inputs can receive video frames **only** if backup file is specified.

cluster_key.description:
Authorization key to fetch the streams from another streamer in a cluster. 
Should be configured for each `input`.

provider.description: Human-readable name of the content provider. Used, for example, for MPEG-TS.

clients_timeout.description:
Stream's lifetime after the last client was disconnected (can be expressed in *seconds* or set to `False`). 
Applicable to on-demand streams **only**.

retry_limit.description:
Number of attempts for the server to reconnect to a data source.
Applicable to on-demand streams **only**. If not defined, server will constantly try to reconnect (unlimited number of retries). 
If the input does not become active after specified amount of attempts, stream shuts down till the next user request.

groups.description:
List of groups the stream belongs to. Can be used for tagging,
API calls, or configuration on restreamers.

source_timeout.description:
If a connected source does not send any data within this timeout period (in seconds), 
the source connection is considered to be lost.
This is a default configuration for a stream, can be modified for any input.

backup.description:
When all inputs are down, this can be used to show at least something to users.
It is important to understand that backup video behaves differently, not as inputs. 
It is not a _last input_ in the list. After any input stops sending frames, timer starts.
After `source_timeout` seconds backup starts working, while all other inputs are still trying to
connect and start working.
So backup and all inputs are working in parallel.

epg_enabled.description: Whether to extract EPG from the input.

auth.description:
Configuration of authorization backend (play sessions **only**).
Should be replaced with an `on_play` configuration similar to `on_publish`.

externalDocs.description: Find more information about `on_play` and `on_publish` here.

on_play.description: Configuraton of authorization backend for play sessions.

on_publish.description: Configuraton of authorization backend for publish sessions.

drm.description: Configuraton of Digital Rights Management system (DRM).

prepush.description:
The time (in seconds) that *Flussonic* reserves for preloading the data, i. e. *buffering*.
Prepush is always defined through GoP, but this option provides you with a more flexible way
to configure the buffer size, e. g. a 1-3 or 7-10 seconds time interval.

The bigger the buffer size, the better the user experience is for the users
with a bad internet connection. However, the latency also increases.

If it is set to `False` to remove the latency, the stream's start time 
increases. To decrease it, reduce the GoP size and make the bitrate larger 
or the video quality lower.

segment_count.description:
Number of segments stored in memory for the segment-based protocols, such as HLS and DASH.
Added to HLS live manifest. Do not forget that one more segment is stored for stale clients
that come too late, but the latest segment is not shown in the manifest.

segment_duration.description:
The time of the segment duration. Used for the protocols like HLS or DASH. 
The disk config offers this value in seconds.

chunk_duration.description: Chunk duration in LL-HLS manifest to be used for tunning latency.

url_prefix.description:
A string starting the addresses of separate segments within a *segment-based* playlists (HLS or DASH).
Each sub-playlist is stored on Flussonic.

If set to `false`, the configured value in a template will be disabled.

hls_scte35.description:
Whether to enable SCTE-35 ad insertion markers signaling in HLS manifest.
Ad markers can be included in SCTE-35 (`scte35`), AWS (`aws`) formats or not included (`false`).

add_audio_only.description:
Whether to add an audio-only version of an HLS stream. 
Used to create App Store compliant HLS streams to deliver the content to Apple iOS devices.

webrtc_abr.description: WebRTC play configuration for a stream.

pushes.description:
A list of pushes. When a server initiates the connection and sends a stream 
to other server(s), it is called a `push`.

mpegts_pids.description:
This parameter sets PIDs values for outgoing MPEG-TS streams. PID contains information about the TS package content and can be decoded according to special service tables. 
It is possible to set PID values for PMT, SDT, video, and audio tracks. Tracks are numbered starting from one. 
The code `a1=123` sets a PID value for the first audio track. It is possible to set the base index for the tracks of a certain type using the 0 (zero) index. 
For example, `t0=100` sets PID=101 for the first track, 102 for the second, and so on. Numbers can be given in decimal form (by default) or hexadecimal with 16# prefix.

mpegts_ac3.description: It allows to specify pack information about ac3 for outgoing MPEGTS-TS streams. The default value is `system_b`.

labels.description: Stream labels in key value format

playback_headers.description: This parameter sets playback HTTP headers for streams.

record_input.description: Configuration of recording the stream input as-is. Recommended for debugging needs **only**.

cluster_ingest.description:
Server configuration for a cluster ingest group.
Used to connect several servers between each other to capture the stream(s) and prevent the failover when one of the servers (peers) fails.
More information about the cluster ingest [here](https://flussonic.com/doc/cluster/video-ingest-in-a-cluster/#cluster-ingest-page).

meta.description: The param is deprecated and now used only for onvif_url and onvif_profile options.

srt.description:
A port used for playing SRT streams. Can be set in global settings or for a particular stream. 
If it is used in the configuration, Flussonic works as a "Listener" and receives connection requests from a source working as a "Caller".
More information [here](https://flussonic.com/doc/video-playback/#srt).

srt2.description:
A port used for playing SRT2 streams. Can be set in global settings or for a particular stream.
If it is used in the configuration, Flussonic works as a "Listener" and receives connection requests from a source working as a "Caller".
More information [here](https://flussonic.com/doc/video-playback/#srt).

srt_play.description: SRT play configuration for a stream.

srt2_play.description: SRT2 play configuration for a stream.

srt_publish.description: SRT publishing configuration for a stream.

srt2_publish.description: SRT2 publishing configuration for a stream.

password.description: Specify a password when publishing a password-protected stream.

aac_ab.description: Bitrate of the AAC audio track.

frames_timeout.description:
Specifies the period of time, in seconds, 
for which Flussonic Media Server waits for new frames to come from the data source 
before it generates the `frames_timed_out` event that informs you that the source might soon be lost. 
This period of time must be smaller than `source_timeout`. 
If frames come again from this source, before `source_timeout` has passed, Flussonic issues the `frames_restored` event.

abr_stepup.description:
Increment step for raising the bitrate to the maximum, in percent. The default step is 30%. 
If the loss is less than `abr_loss_lower`, 
Flussonic makes the publisher to step up from the current bitrate to the maximum one with the rate of `abr_stepup percent`.

abr_correction.description:
The correction between the target bitrate (Receiver Estimated Maximum Bitrate, calculated in Flussonic) and browser bitrate, in kbit/s.
Flussonic sends the target bitrate to the browser from which the publication is carried out so that the browser adjusts the bitrate of the publication by this value.
The default value is 300 kbit/s.

abr_loss_lower.description:
The lower limit of packet loss. When it is reached, Flussonic raises the bitrate. 
That is, if packet loss is less than `abr_loss_lower`, Flussonic makes the publisher to step up from the current bitrate to the maximum one with the rate of `abr_stepup` percent.

abr_loss_upper.description:
The upper limit of packet loss. When it is reached, Flussonic reduces the bitrate. 
That is, if packet loss is greater than `abr_loss_upper`, Flussonic makes the publisher to reduce the current bitrate in steps with the maximum rate of `abr_stepdown` percent.

abr_stepdown.description:
A step of reducing the bitrate to the minimum. 
If packet losses are greater than `abr_loss_upper`, Flussonic makes the publisher to reduce the current bitrate in steps with the maximum rate of `abr_stepdown` percent.

abr_mode.description:
The algorithm for determining the need to change the bitrate of the published stream and for calculating the target bitrate. 
Two options are possible:

* `abr_mode=0` - This mode takes into account the packet losses, target bitrate, browser bitrate and the number of auto-adjustment cycles.
* `abr_mode=1` - This mode considers only packet losses and target bitrate.

abr_debug.description: Whether adaptive bitrate process is logged.

abr_cycles.description:
The number of cycles of bitrate auto-adjustment.
After the specified number of auto-adjustment cycles passes, Flussonic considers the bitrate to be optimal, and it is no longer analyzed. 
By default, `abr_cycles`=5. 
If `abr_cycles`=0, the adjustment process takes place all the time while the publication lasts.

config_on_disk.description: Part of the effective config from the configuration file.

config_override.description: Part of the effective config overridden in runtime, e. g. `on_play`, `on_publish`.

stats.description: Stream's metrics and other statistical information.

prefixes.description:
List of prefixes that will be used to create dynamic names for published streams. 
A template creates one publishing point with one or more publishing locations, depending on the number of prefixes you define. 
All settings within the template with prefixes apply to the streams published under the name of the prefixes. 
You can also specify an empty prefix (`""`) to publish a stream with any prefix or even without a prefix.

opened_at.description: The time when the pusher instance was created (in UTC).

bytes.description: Total amount of bytes sent since the pusher was created.

since.description: The time, in UTC seconds, of the last error (is the pusher does not work) or of the pusher start (if it works).

retries.description: Number of retries since the last successful push.

last_error.description: If the pusher does not work, this field displays the text of the last error.

sent_bytes.description: Total amount of bytes sent since the pusher was created.

service.description:
The service information passed to VBI of the output analog stream.
The allowed value is `ttxt` - teletext.

lines.description: Numbers of VBI lines that will carry a teletext track.

path.description:
Path to the logo file.
If specified without the `@` in the beginning, the logo will be served from the webroot (***not recommended***).
If specified with the `@` in the beginning, the logo will be served from the special directory and can be
managed by the logo API.

height.description: Set the specified height for the logo.

width.description: Set the specified width for the logo.

left.description: Change the position of the logo to the left.

top.description: Change the position of the logo to the top.

right.description: Change the position of the logo to the right.

bottom.description: Change the position of the logo to the bottom.

http.description: List of HTTP ports or `host:port` pairs that will be used for listening.

https.description: List of HTTPS ports or `host:port` pairs that will be used for listening.

rtmp.description: List of RTMP ports or `host:port` pairs that will be used for listening.

rtmps.description: List of RTMPS ports or `host:port` pairs that will be used for listening.

rtsp.description: List of RTSP ports or `host:port` pairs that will be used for listening.

rtsps.description: List of RTSPS ports or `host:port` pairs that will be used for listening.

turn.description: List of TURN ports or `host:port` pairs that will be used for listening.

snmp.description: List of SNMP ports or `host:port` pairs that will be used for listening.

sip.description: List of SIP ports or `host:port` pairs that will be used for listening.

port.description: Port that will be used for listening.

address.description: Network address that will be used for listening.

ssl_protocols.description: List of SSL protocol versions that will be used for listening.

api.description: If false, listener do not serve api calls.
If false, listener do not serve api calls.

opened_at.description: The time this input instance was created (in UTC seconds).

connected_at.description: The time network connection was established (in UTC milliseconds).

started_at.description: The time the first frames appeared (in UTC milliseconds).

bytes.description: Total amount of bytes sent since the input was created.

error.description: Information about the last source error.

media_info.description: Technical description of the input content.

last_dts.description: Last frame timestamp coming from this input.

last_dts_at.description: Last time a frame was processed from this input (in UTC).

active.description: Whether this input is selected as active for the stream.

dvr_info.description: Information about DVR stored on disk.

url.description: Target URL to push a video stream to.

stats.description: Detailed runtime information about the push.

multicast_loop.description:
Whether to capture multicast back to the *Flussonic* host. 
This option allows you to ingest the sent stream on the sending host by *Flussonic* or other application.
Set to `True` for a UDP MPEG-TS push.

vb.description:
Average bitrate per second that you can send of a video track, including all the headers and encapsulation in the transport stream. 
So, for example, the value of vb=2720 approximately corresponds to the bitrate 2600 specified in the transcoder settings.

bitrate.description: The bitrate of the whole stream.

pnr.description: Program number in the outgoing MPEG-TS stream. A program may represent a television channel.

pmt.description:
PID of Program Map Table (PMT) in the outgoing MPEG-TS stream.

PMT contains the description of each program and lists the PIDs of elementary streams associated with that program.
For instance, a transport stream used in digital television might contain three programs, to represent three television channels. 
Suppose each channel consists of one video stream, one or two audio streams, and any necessary metadata. 
A receiver wishing to decode one of the three channels merely has to decode the payloads of each PID associated with its program. 
It can discard the contents of all other PIDs.

pids.description:
This parameter sets PIDs values for outgoing MPEG-TS streams. 
It is possible to set PID values for PMT, STD and video and audio tracks.

mpegts_ac3.description: It allows to specify pack information about ac3 for outgoing MPEGTS-TS streams. The default value is `system_b`.

dns.description: Separate DNS server for a pusher.
dns.x-notice: this is a bad designed push of Akamai

retry_limit.description: The maximum number of times *Flussonic* retries to push the stream.

retry_timeout.description:
How often *Flussonic* should retry attempts to send the stream, e.g., if it has become offline. 
It is an interval in seconds, 5 seconds by default. 
You can increase this value to reduce server load.

timeout.description: Time interval, in seconds, after which the pusher is stopped if the source stream or publishing is stopped.

volume.description:
Audio volume coefficient.
The output audio volume is given by the relation: `output_volume = volume * input_volume`.
The maximum volume value is 1.0 (default value).

deinterlace.description:
Activate deinterlacing, i.e., converting an interlaced image to a progressive image. 
It is necessary for comfortable viewing of legacy TV video on PC/mobile devices.

fps.description:
Frame rate (frames per second) - the speed at which a sequence of images is displayed on a screen.
Higher frame rates capture more images per second, which makes for smoother video.

The standard frame rate for color television in the Phase Alternating Line (PAL) format is 25 fps.
The standard frame rate for color television in the National Television System Committee (NTSC) format is 29,97 fps
(a little bit lower than the original frame rate of black and white NTSC television, equal to 30 fps.)
If interlaced TV is used, two fields of each frame (with odd-numbered lines and with even-numbered lines) are displayed consequently,
but the frame rate is actually not doubled (50 half-frames are still equal to 25 original frames).

size.description: The size of output frame in pixels.

format.description:
The Decklink capture mode supported by a card. 
Usually a Decklink card supports a limited set of modes. 
Each mode is a combination of a frame size and FPS, encoded in Decklink format.
For example, `Hp50` is for 1920x1080 size with 50.00 FPS.

You can set this value manually or set size and FPS, and Flussonic will try to choose the appropriate format.

vbi_lines.description:
Lines of VBI (vertical blanking interval) of an output analog stream that will contain teletext.
It is used for passing teletext from MPEG-TS to analog streams.

dthreads.description:
Defines a number of threads in a decoder. 
One thread uses one core. 
The default value equals 4, but you can set it equal to the number of cores of your CPU.

scale.description:
Defines a scaling algorithm.
You can choose only one algorithm at a time. 
If a pushing stream has the same video resolution as an ingest stream, the `fast_bilinear` algorithm is used by default. 
If a video resolution of a pushing stream does not equal the video resolution of an ingest stream, the bicubic algorithm is used by default. 
If the algorithm is specified explicitly, it applies to all the formats.

disabled.description:
Disable pushing the stream.

Temporary disabling, or pausing, an offline stream eliminates the necessity to remove it from the the configuration in order to stop Flussonic trying to push it. 
In this way, the URL and other settings of a disabled stream remain in Flussonic.

minversion.description:
The minimum SRT version that is required from the peer for SRT publication.
The format is `x.y.z`. 
The default value is `1.0.0`.

version.description:
Required SRT version. The format is `x.y.z`.
The default value is `1.0.0`.

enforcedencryption.description:
Whether both connection parties must have the same password set (including empty, in other words, with no encryption). 
If the passwords do not match or only one side is unencrypted, the connection is rejected. 
The default value is `true`.

passphrase.description:
The password for the encrypted transmission. 
Its length should be not less than 10 and not more than 79 characters. 
The default value is an empty string ("").

connect_timeout.description: Connection timeout, in seconds. Equals to 0 by default.

linger.description:
The time, in seconds, that the socket waits for the unsent data before closing. 
The default value is 180.

latency.description:
Packet delivery delay. 
Used to avoid bursts of missed packet retransmissions. The default value is 120.

streamid.description:
A string of maximum 512 characters set on the socket before the connection. 

This string is a part of a callback that is sent by the caller and regisered by the listener. 
Based on this information the listener can accept or reject the connection, select the desired data stream, or set an appropriate passphrase for the connection.

Its format is `#!::` optionally followed by the parameters:
* `r=` - stream name
* `m=` - mode expected for connection: `publish` (if the caller wants to send the stream data) or `request` (if the caller wants to receive the stream).

During SRT sessions between two Flussonic Media Services, the following parameters are automaticly added to `streamid`:
* `s=` - the identifier of a session
* `a=` - Flussonic verion

standby.description: Monitoring multicast group and stop pushing if another publisher presented

url.description:
Unified URL to connect to the source and get the stream.
However, not all protocols use URLs to describe the peer-to-peer connection.

For instance, WebRTC, SRT, and RTMP. 

WebRTC uses SDP (Session Description Protocol) to describe the negotiation between the peers.

SRT requires IP and port, so we create an artificial URL to specify the options to manage the data interchange.

RTMP uses a special URL consisting of at least two segments. *Flussonic* parses the URL and splits it into parts, 
using the first segment as an RTMP application name.

source_timeout.description: The period of time, in seconds, for which Flussonic will wait for new frames until it considers the source as lost.

timeout.description:
The time, in seconds, for Flussonic to switch to the fallback source if the main source stops sending frames (video or audio). 
The important thing here is that the source remains active (connected), allowing for a client-publisher to stay on the socket.

frames_timeout.description:
Specifies the period of time, in seconds, for which Flussonic Media Server waits for new frames to come from the data source before it generates the `frames_timed_out` event that informs you that the source might soon be lost. 
This period of time must be smaller than `source_timeout`. 
If frames come again from this source, before `source_timeout` has passed, Flussonic issues the `frames_restored` event.

priority.description:
The priority that Flussonic takes into account when switching to another source.
The source with `priority=1` has the first priority, the source with `priority=2` has the second priority, and so on.

By default, the first source in the list has the highest priority and the last source in the list has the lowest priority. 
If priority is not specified for some sources, or if some sources have equal priorities, then the default order is applied.

stats.description: Detailed runtime information about the input.

user_agent.description: User agent. Can be modified if a protocol allows it.

cluster_key.description: Authorization key used to fetch the stream from another streamer in a cluster.

via.description: Agent ID. Used as a proxy to connect to the input server.

max_bitrate.description: Maximum bitrate value. *Flussonic* checks the input bitrate value, and if it overflows this value, the input will be disconnected.

remote_dvr.description:
Mode to describe the interconnection with a DVR on a remote server.
Allows to chain requests to other servers or read-only from a peer.

headers.description: An array of additional properties for customization of the request headers.

no_clients_reconnect_delay.description: Skip input start if the stream has no clients.

allow_if.description:
Path to a file. The input will be allowed if you put `1` in the file, or denied if `0` (reverse logic to `deny_if`).
This option allows you to manage inputs without API requests.

For example, your stream has two inputs and you set `allow_if = /path/to/file` for the first input.
The `/path/to/file` file contains only the digit `1`. That means that the first input is used when you play the stream.
When you put `0` to the `/path/to/file` file, the first input is denied, so the second one is played.

If no such file, the input is allowed.

deny_if.description:
Path to a file. The input will be denied if you put `1` in the file, or allowed if `0` (reverse logic to `allow_if`).
This option allows you to manage inputs without API requests.

For example, your stream has two inputs and you set `deny_if = /path/to/file` for the first input.
The `/path/to/file` file contains only the digit `1`. 
That means that the first input will not be used when you play the stream, so the second one will.
When you put `0` to the `/path/to/file` file, the first input is allowed to be played.

If no such file, the input is allowed.

aac.x-notice: used in rtsp_source instead of rtsp2
aac.description: Enables transcoding to the AAC codec for the audio track of the input.

width.description:
Width of an artificially created test video stream. 
Applicable to the `fake://fake` URL.

height.description:
Height of an artificially created test video stream. 
Applicable to the `fake://fake` URL.

bitrate.description:
Bitrate of an artificially created test video stream. 
Applicable to the `fake://fake` URL.

buffer.description: HLS segments buffer. Forces to collect extra N segments first. Useful at bad connections, but increases the lag.

skip_stalled_check.description:
By default Flussonic will wait for at least 2-3 new segments before making stream available.

This parameter allows to disable this protection. Use it at your own risk - with it enabled, old content might be repeated over and over.

ad.description: Alias for `scte35`. Enables the ad injection.

pageUrl.description:
URL of the web page from where the SWF file was loaded. 
This is an RTMP header (Referer) used for establishing connection.

swfUrl.description: URL of the source SWF file making the connection by RTMP.

tcUrl.description:
URL of the remote Server for entering credentials. 
It has the following format: `protocol://servername:port/appName/appInstance`.

rtp.description: Whether to force UDP to capture a video from RTSP cameras.

wait_rtcp.description: Whether to wait for the full RTP time synchronization before the processing of frames from the RTSP camera.

mode.description:
Mode of the input stream captured from the Decklink card. It is composed of the size and FPS of the captured video. 

Usually, it is autodetected, but for some Decklink models that you'll need to specify it manually.

ainput.description:
Audio interface for capturing from the Decklink card.

Usually, it is autodetected, but for some Decklink models you should specify it manually.

vinput.description:
Video interface for capturing from the Decklink card.
