Usually, it is autodetected, but for some Decklink models you should specify it manually.

vpts.description: Synchronization mode for video captured from the Decklink card.

oneOf.description: Synchronization by audio.
Synchronization according to the timing reference signal.
Equivalent of 'audio'.
Equivalent of 'ref'.

apts.description: Synchronization mode for audio captured from the Decklink card.

oneOf.description: Synchronization by video.
Synchronization according to the timing reference signal.
Equivalent of 'video'.
Equivalent of 'ref'.

pixel.description: Preferred pixel format for captured video.

oneOf.description: rgb color model and 8 bits per pixel.
rgb color model and 10 bits per pixel.
rgb color model and 12 bits per pixel.
YUV color model and 8 bits per pixel.
YUV color model and 10 bits per pixel.
equivalent of `yuv8`.
equivalent of `yuv10`.

channel.description: If an AJA SDI card has multiple output channels, specify the number of the channel to ingest video from.

sar.description:
The ratio of the width of the display representation to the width of the pixel representation of video.

This parameter is used for creating non-anamorphic video from anamorphic video.

audio_device.description:
The audio device to capture audio from Stream Labs SDI cards.

This parameter is specified for ALSA devices in the following format `interface:card,device`.

video_device.description:
The video device to capture video from Stream Labs SDI cards.
It is actually a path to a device file created on the disk by Video4Linux.

vbi_device.description:
The VBI device to capture raw VBI data from Stream Labs SDI cards. VBI data can contain information about teletext or closed captions.
It is actually a path to a VBI device file created on the disk by Video4Linux.

ttxt_descriptors.description: This information is necessary for adding into the PMT table to identify streams which carry teletext data in the resulting MPEG-TS stream.

vbi_threshold.description:
This parameter is used for debugging when reading teletext from VBI.
This is a threshold, in seconds, for turning on the decoder.

vbi_debug.description: This parameter allows logging the decoded data when reading teletext from VBI.

minversion.description:
The minimum SRT version that is required from the peer for SRT publication.
The format is `x.y.z`. 
The default value is `1.0.0`.

version.description:
Required SRT version. The format is `x.y.z`.
The default value is `1.0.0`.

enforcedencryption.description:
Whether both connection parties must have the same password set (including empty, in other words, with no encryption). 
If the passwords do not match or only one side is unencrypted, the connection is rejected. 
The default value is `true`.

passphrase.description:
The password for the encrypted transmission. 
Its length should be not less than 10 and not more than 79 characters. 
The default value is an empty string ("").

connect_timeout.description: Connection timeout, in seconds. Equals to 0 by default.

linger.description:
The time, in seconds, that the socket waits for the unsent data before closing. 
The default value is 180.

latency.description:
Packet delivery delay. 
Used to avoid bursts of missed packet retransmissions. The default value is 120.

streamid.description:
A string of maximum 512 characters set on the socket before the connection. 

This string is a part of a callback that is sent by the caller and regisered by the listener. 
Based on this information the listener can accept or reject the connection, select the desired data stream, or set an appropriate passphrase for the connection.

Its format is `#!::` optionally followed by the parameters:
* `r=` - stream name
* `m=` - mode expected for the connection: `publish` (if the caller wants to send the stream data) or `request` (if the caller wants to receive the stream).
* `password=` - a password for the authorization in a publish session (not recommended, better use `passphrase` option instead)

During SRT sessions between two Flussonic Media Servers, the following parameters are automaticly added to streamid:
* `s=` - the identifier of a session
* `a=` - Flussonic version

programs.description: Choose a program to ingest from an MPEG-TS stream.

pids.description:
Choose a specific PID to ingest from an MPEG-TS stream. 
PID identifies separate data stream inside the multiplexed MPEG-TS stream. 
It is possible to set PID values for PMT, SDT, video, and audio tracks.

allow_subtitles.description:
Ingesting subtitles when capturing video from an MPEG-TS stream.
This option is now deprecated (replaced by `subtitles=accept`) and supported only for backward compatibility.

subtitles.description: This parameter allows to manage subtitles in an output stream.

oneOf.description: An output stream will have no subtitles track.
An output stream will have a subtitles track in DVB, without conversion to text (default behavior).
An output stream will have a track containing subtitles converted to a text format (WebVTT).

An output stream will have two tracks containing subtitles: 
the original track with subtitles in DVB and a new track with text subtitles.

closed_captions.description: The rules for handling the closed captions.

dvbsubs_ocr.description:
This option turns on the DVB subtitle OCR feature.
If it is enabled, the resulting track with text subtitles replaces the track with DVB subtitles in an output stream.
This option is now deprecated (replaced by `subtitles=ocr_replace`) and supported only for backward compatibility.

scte35.description:
This option disables processing of SCTE-35 markers from an MPEG-TS input stream.
Deprecated since 22.12.
Available ways to disable processing of SCTE-35 markers:
1. pids option to select tracks without SCTE-35 markers
2. hls_scte35 option from stream_config_media for hls output
3. performing appropriate tuning pids in the transponder

languages.description: An array of MPEG-TS language descriptors in format `[{key: track, value: language}]`

prefer_codec.description: Choose one of the listed video codecs at the start of the publication via WebRTC.

transport.description: Choose the prefered transport of the publication via WebRTC: UDP or TCP.

min_bitrate.description: The minimum bitrate threshold, in kbit/s. The default value is 100 kbit/s.

webrtc_abr.description: Whether the adaptive bitrate mechanism is used for WebRTC publications.

abr_stepup.description:
Increment step for raising the bitrate to the maximum, in percent. The default step is 30%. 
If the loss is less than `abr_loss_lower`, Flussonic makes the publisher to step up from the current bitrate to the maximum one with the rate of `abr_stepup percent`.

abr_correction.description:
The correction between the target bitrate (Receiver Estimated Maximum Bitrate, calculated in Flussonic) and browser bitrate, in kbit/s.
Flussonic sends the target bitrate to the browser from which the publication is carried out so that the browser adjusts the bitrate of the publication by this value.
The default value is 300 kbit/s.

abr_loss_lower.description:
The lower limit of packet loss. When it is reached, Flussonic raises the bitrate. 
That is, if packet loss is less than `abr_loss_lower`, Flussonic makes the publisher to step up from the current bitrate to the maximum one with the rate of `abr_stepup` percent.

abr_loss_upper.description:
The upper limit of packet loss. When it is reached, Flussonic reduces the bitrate. 
That is, if packet loss is greater than `abr_loss_upper`, Flussonic makes the publisher to reduce the current bitrate in steps with the maximum rate of `abr_stepdown` percent.

abr_stepdown.description:
A step of reducing the bitrate to the minimum. 
If packet losses are greater than `abr_loss_upper`, Flussonic makes the publisher to reduce the current bitrate in steps with the maximum rate of `abr_stepdown` percent.

abr_mode.description:
The algorithm for determining the need to change the bitrate of the published stream and for calculating the target bitrate. 
Two options are possible:

* `abr_mode=0` - This mode takes into account the packet losses, target bitrate, browser bitrate and the number of auto-adjustment cycles.
* `abr_mode=1` - This mode considers only packet losses and target bitrate.

abr_debug.description: Whether adaptive bitrate process is logged.

abr_cycles.description:
The number of cycles of bitrate auto-adjustment.
After the specified number of auto-adjustment cycles passes, Flussonic considers the bitrate to be optimal, and it is no longer analyzed. 
By default, `abr_cycles`=5. 
If `abr_cycles`=0, the adjustment process takes place all the time while the publication lasts.

sync.description:
This parameter is used for a mixer stream that uses other streams as its video and audio sources.

If the parameter is set to `realtime`, audio frames will be played in sync with video frames: 
if the difference between timestamps of an audio frame and a corresponding video frame is more than 2 seconds, 
the audio frame will be played at the timestamp of the video frame. 

If this parameter is set to `dts`, no synchronization is performed.

audio_add.description: Moves audio timestamp forwards or backwards on a specified number of milliseconds.

start_track.description:
Video track number from which playback starts. Possible values: `v1`, `v2`, `v3` and so on.

If not specified, or an audio track specified (`start_track=a3`), or a video track number does not exist, 
playback starts with the track number in the middle of the list (e.g. `v2` if you have tracks `v1`, `v2`, and `v3`) 
and then adjusts to the bandwidth availability.

If some tracks are excluded by the query parameter `?filter=tracks:...`, Flussonic searches for an available track with a lower number up to v0. 
If no track with a lower number was found, Flussonic searches for a closest track with a higher number.

vendor.description:
DRM vendor. DRM (Digital Rights Management) is a content protection method where the content is encrypted and decrypted 
by a pair of keys that are generated by the key server of the DRM system.

Flussonic supports the following DRM systems: EzDRM, DRM Conax, DRM Conax for Nagra, BuyDRM (KeyOS), Widevine, PallyCon, Irdeto, PlayReady DRM, GS DRM, Solocoo
vendor.x-notice: aes128 | ezdrm | keyos | conax | pallycon | gsdrm

user_keyserver.description: The URL sent to the client for watching the content. Used for Verimatrix DRM.

resource_id.description:
The ID of a resource (a stream or a VOD file) in DRM system, usually it is a UUID.
The DRM system keeps track of viewing each resource by clients.

A resource ID is automatically generated for each stream or VOD file by Flussonic but it changes after renaming. 
It is possible to set it manually to attach a stream to a particular resource or to combine several streams into one.

expires.description:
Key rotation interval, in minutes.

By default, Flussonic does not rotate enryption keys. 
Specify this parameter to enable encryption key rotation and thus to provide a better securtiy.

encryption.description:
If this parameter is set to `full`, all frames are encrypted. 
If it is set to `sparse` (or empty), only the keyframes are encrypted.

By default, Flussonic encrypts only key frames. In most cases this is enough to protect the stream from an unauthorized access. 
It also reduces the power consumption, when decrypting on the client side. 
However, some Smart TVs and STBs require all frames to be encrypted.

aes_key.description: AES (Advanced Encryption Standard) key. Used for Widevine DRM.

content_id.description:
A unique identifier of the content, used for Widevine DRM.
By default, it is equal to the stream name.

signer.description:
A unique ID of the signer. 
Flussonic uses it to connect to the key server when using test key for Widevine DRM.

iv.description:
Initialization vector (IV) - an arbitrary number that can be used along with a secret key for data encryption. 
It is employed only one time in any session.
The use of an IV prevents repetition in data encryption, making it more difficult for a hacker to break a cipher. 

Usually, IV is received from a DVR provider.

secret.description: A part of the keyserver's URL when using Solcoo DRM: `https://SITE.solocoo.tv/SITEadmintools/papi/SECRET/method`.

site.description: A part of the keyserver's URL when using Solcoo DRM: `https://SITE.solocoo.tv/SITEadmintools/papi/SECRET/method`.

fp.description:
Whether to use FairPlay system for key generation. 
If set to `false`, the requests for FairPlay encryption key are disabled.
Used for Solocoo DRM.

account_id.description: ID of the Irdeto DRM account. Ask your Irdeto manager for it.

ic_host.description: A hostname of Irdeto DRM key server. Ask your Irdeto manager for it.

password.description: A password for authorization of a user on a key server. Used for Irdeto DRM and EZDRM.

user_name.description: A user name of the Irdeto DRM user. Ask your Irdeto manager for it.

user.description: A user name for authorization of a user on a key server. Used for EZDRM.

keyseed.description:
An arbitrary Base64-encoded string of 30 bytes. 
It is used for PlayReady DRM and is necessary for PlayReady to create an encryption key.

key_id.description: A key ID (hash code of a stream name) used for an encryption key generation. Used for PlayReady DRM.

userkey.description: A unique identifier of the user in Buy DRM.

enc_token.description:
An API authentication token that is generated when you sign up for the PallyCon service at https://login.pallycon.com/.
Used for PallyCon DRM.

user_path.description: A custom key server path for Conax DRM.

dump_url.description: Whether the requested encryption URL is logged.

hls_ext_x_key_iv.description:
This parameter is used for encryption of HLS streams.
For successful playback of an AES128 encrypted HLS streams on some modern devices (running on Tizen 5), 
set this pareameter to `false`.

systems.description:
This parameter is used for Conax DRM for Nagra Security Services Platform.

If you turned off some of the systems (FairPlay, PlayReady, or Widevine) in your Nagra account, you should specify the systems that remain in use. 
Otherwise, an error will occur in Conax, and it will be impossible to play the stream.

la_url.description: License URL, used for PlayReady DRM.

oneOf.description: Media is described in file on local disk
Media was started and configured by user request: play or publish
Media was sourced from another streamer via `source` directive
Media was configured via config_external backend

file.description:
Path to the backup file in a VOD location on the server (**not on the local disk!**). 
The backup file is played to fill in a time interval when the source is down.

timeout.description:
The time (in seconds) for Flussonic to switch to the fallback source if the main source stops sending frames. 
The important thing here is that the source remains active (connected), allowing for a client-publisher to stay on the socket.
This option takes any type of frames into account. 

If you do not specify timeout specifically for a fallback source, then in the absence of frames, `source_timeout` of the main source will be used.

audio_timeout.description: The time (in seconds) for Flussonic to switch to the fallback source if the main source stops sending audio frames.

video_timeout.description: The time (in seconds) for Flussonic to switch to the fallback source if the main source stops sending video frames.

transcode.description:
Whether or not to transcode the backup file. Set to `True` by default. 
If set to `False`, backup file frames will bypass as-is to the output stream.

Should not be set to `False` unless the backup file has the same stream characteristics
as the live stream.

dvr.description:
Whether or not to record a backup to DVR. 
Set to `False` by default (backup is not recorded).

oneOf.description: Allow all playback sessions. Use the value to override template value.

from.description: The UTC timestamp of the first recording in this archive.

depth.description: The time interval between the start of the *first* recording segment and the end of the *last* one.

motion_log.description: The list of events from the motion detector (if it is enabled).

bytes.description: The size of the recorded archive.

disk_size.description: The size of the disk where the archive is recorded.

duration.description: A total duration of the recorded segments, excluding recording gaps.

capture_at.description: Preferred server to run the main stream on.

pmt.description:
PID  of the elementary stream that contains Program Map Table (PMT) in the outgoing MPEG-TS stream.

PMT contains the description of each program and lists the PIDs of elementary streams associated with that program.
For instance, a transport stream used in digital television might contain three programs, to represent three television channels. 
Suppose each channel consists of one video stream, one or two audio streams, and any necessary metadata. 
A receiver wishing to decode one of the three channels merely has to decode the payloads of each PID associated with its program. 
It can discard the contents of all other PIDs.

pcr.description:
PID of the elementary stream that contains PCR (Program Clock Reference) in the outgoing MPEG-TS stream.

PCR is the time label used for synchronization of a stream playback with real time. 
Additionally, for DVB streams it is used for managing a decoder and its buffer. 
In this case, PCR gives a signal to the frames with DTS<PCR to be sent to the decoder from the buffer. 
This mechanism allows to compensate different sizes of frames: if a frame is too big to be played in time with a specified FPS, the frames from the buffer are played.

sdt.description:
PID  of the elementary stream that contains Service Description Table (SDT) in the outgoing MPEG-TS stream.
SDT provides information about services contained in MPEG-TS stream.

media.description: Information about a particular media track.

default.description:
The default algorithm of selecting PID for a track.

* `auto`: track PID = PMT PID + track ID, 
where PMT PID is the PID of Program Map Table and track ID is a number of the track set by Flussonic 
(usually, all video tracks and then all audio tracks are numbered starting from 1).
* `increment`: track PID = previous track PID + 1.

oneOf.description: pal 720x576 @ 50Hz interlace SMPTE-259
Similar PAL
NTSC 720x480 @ 59.94Hz interlace SMPTE-259
Similar NTSC
Similar NTSC
1280x720 @ 23.98Hz progressive SMPTE-296
Similar 720p23.98
1920x1080 @ 23.98Hz progressive SMPTE-274
1920x1080 @ 23.98Hz progressive Progressive segmented Frame SMPTE-274
1920x1080 @ 50Hz progressive annex A or annex B depending hardware SMPTE-274
1920x1080 @ 50Hz progressive annex B SMPTE-274
4k 3840x2160 @ 50Hz progressive SMPTE-2036

url.description: Push URL for the MPTS stream. Usually it is a `udp://` multicast address and port.

multicast_loop.description:
The multicast socket option that enables ingesting the sent data back to the transponder.
Use for test purposes, e.g. if the same server creates MTPS and splits MPTS to separate programs.

tos.description: ToS byte in the IP packages of the multicasted data.

standby.description: Monitoring multicast group and stop pushing if another publisher presented

psi.description: Global version for all PSI tables.

time_of_change.description: Date and time when the time change takes place.

local_time_offset.description: The current offset time from UTC.

next_time_offset.description: The next offset time after the change.

max_bitrate.description: Maximum bitrate for the transponder's EIT EPG.

xmltv_url.description: Directory for storing the XMLTV EPG files.

keep_epg.description: Period for storing the XMLTV files.

intervals_pf.description: Periods for sending the present/following events.

intervals_schedule.description: Periods for sending the event schedules.

program_id.description: Identifier of the program within the transponder.

source.description: The stream that is in use as the program source.

vb.description: This property is no longer supported, use individual [`bitrate`](https://flussonic.com/doc/video-playback/udp-multicast-with-constant-bitrate/#settings-bitrates-of-tracks) option for a program PID.

pushes.description: The list of pushes for the transponder.

network_name.description: The name of the TV network.

ts_stream_id.description: The identifier of the transport stream for the transponder.

original_network_id.description: Identifier of the original delivery network. The same original network is used for NIT and SDT.

ts_descriptors.description: The list of transport stream descriptors. Descriptors are added to NIT and SDT.

timeouts.description: The list of timeouts for autodetect of provider, title, and service_type of the programs.

programs.description: The list of programs in the transponder.

others.description: The list of other transponders on the network.

eit.description: Transponder's program guide in EIT format.

video_buffer.description: The size of the video buffer for the transponder.

prebuffer.description:
The length of multiplexer input buffer.
The higher value makes the multiplexer more robust to non-uniform inputs.
The lower value reduces input-to-output latency, but requires more stable bitrate (CBR) on input.

name.description: The name of the other transponder on the network.

stats.description: Statistics on peers in the cluster.

api_url.description:
The internal address for internal communication between the server and the peers. 
Internal communications are based on API so this is basically an URL for API calls. This URL does not have to be public.
The API URL can include a port number, or the port number can be set by the `admin_http` parameter.

public_payload_url.description:
The public address that is exposed to clients. It can also contain a port number.
The client will be redirected to this URL and port when requesting for the stream captured on the peer
even if other `http` port is set in the peer's own config.

public.description: The public address that is exposed to clients.

private_payload_url.description: The internal address for communication in a local network (by default, it is equal to API URL).

fetch_timeout.description: How often the peer will try to get the data from the remote server via internal API.

stale_timeout.description:
The time after which deleted streams on this server are considered to be inactive 
and cannot be used in the `cluster_ingest` mechanism.

cluster_key.description:
The key for authorization for inter-Flussonic connections.
All cluster peers should have the same cluster key.

max_bitrate.description: Maximal output bitrate of the peer.

servers.description: Balancer will distribute requests between these servers.

oneOf.title: Usage
oneOf.description: Bandwidth usage

oneOf.title: Clients
oneOf.description: Total clients number

oneOf.title: Bitrate
oneOf.description: Total output bitrate

oneOf.title: Streams
oneOf.description: Streams number

name.description: Hostname of the peer. Can refer to globally defined peer.

max_bitrate.description: Maximum allowed bitrate, request is redirecting if current bitrate is lower.

countries.description: Client will be redirected to the peer if its IP belongs to one of these countries.

countries_default.description: This flag allows to redirect a request to this peer if "countries" list not matched.

name.description: Tha name of the source group.

auth.description: Configuration of the authorization backend (play session **only**). To be replaced with `on_play` configuration.

on_play.description: Path to auth backend, either HTTP URL or path to script on disk. Play sessions only.

segment_duration.description: The time, in seconds, of the segment duration. Used for the protocols like HLS or DASH.

url.description: URL and port of the remote server to get streams from.

prefix.description: The prefix used for the streams on the remote server from which the peer gets them.

streams.description: The list of streams coming from the source. Replaced with `only` and `except` in newer versions.

only.description:
White list of streams. 
The items of the array may be individual stream names or values like `prefix/*`
which stands for all streams with the given prefix.

except.description: Black list of streams. Higher priority than `only`.

group_config.description: Configuration applied to the specific group of streams (all or limited by `only` and `except`) received from the sources.

stream_names.description: List of streams that use this logo

content_type.description: Content type of this logo. Calculated from file name extension

prefix.description:
The unique name of VOD location. 
It is used as a prefix for playing VOD files in this location.

url.description: URL of the file or directory.

folder.description: Name of the folder containing the file or directory.

subpath.description: Subpath to the file or directory in the storage.

is_multibitrate_directory.description: Whether it is a directory with multi-bitrate content.

opened.description: Whether the file or directory is currently opened.

worker_count.description: Number of worker threads on the server executing the task of playing the file.

client_count.description: Number of clients playing the file.

bytes_in.description: Number of bytes read from the disk.

bytes_out.description: Number of bytes downloaded form the disk.

media_info.description: Technical information about the output media content.

url.description:
The storage (on the disk or on another server) that Flussonic will scan for VOD files.
If it is a path on the disk, it should be specified relating to the disk root.

It is possible to specify multiple storages for one VOD location. When Flussonic gets the URL for playing the file, it finds the prefix in this URL, 
cuts the path after it and consequently searches for this path in all specified storages.

prefix.description:
The unique name of VOD location. 

It is used as a prefix in file playback requests to explicitly specify where the system should find the files for playing. 
All the path after the prefix will be cut and added to the specified path on the disk (the storage configured for this VOD location). 
Thus, the system will find the file on the disk and play it.

auto_mbr.description: Turns on automatic creation of a multi-bitrate HLS playlist from several files with different bitrates.

position.description: If an order of VOD locations is declared, it is a position of the this VOD location in the order.

disabled.description: Whether this VOD location is disabled.

storages.description: The directories (on disk or on another server) that Flussonic scans for VOD files.

auth.description: Configuraton of the authorization backend for play sessions **only**.

on_play.description: Configuraton of the authorization backend for play sessions **only**.

cache.description:
Configuraton of the local file cache which is used for files from a cloud or an HTTP server.

If this option is enabled, a file will be downloaded to a local cache path by megabyte blocks. 
During playback, the file will be first read from the cache. 
This allows to avoid multiple HTTP requests to the source for each part of data and, thus, to speed up broadcasting.

read_queue.description: The number of simultaneous readers form disk that should wait in a queue for playing a file.

max_readers.description: The number of simultaneous requests to disk for a given prefix.

download.description:
Enables downloading files from the URL `http://FLUSSONIC-IP:80/vod_prefix/file_subpath.mp4`. 
The `Range` HTTP headers are supported.

url_prefix.description:
The names of separate segments within a segment-based HLS or DASH playlist start with the *specified* prefix. 
The option no longer works for *variant playlists*.

segment_duration.description: The time, in seconds, of the segment duration. Used for the protocols like HLS or DASH.

timeout.description:
The time (in milliseconds) passed since the last file request.
If the file was not requested within this period, it will be closed and its resources will be deallocated.

add_audio_only.description:
Whether to add an audio-only version of an HLS stream. 
Used to create App Store compliant HLS streams to deliver the content to Apple iOS devices.
Add audio-only HLS playlist to variant MBR playlist for iOS compliant streaming.

provider.description: Human-readable name of the content provider. Applicable to MPEG-TS.

system.description: Adapter type. Different systems are supported besides DVB, as the configuring is similar.

frequency.description: The carrier frequency of the transponder for this channel, in Hz.

symbol_rate.description:
The symbol rate of the transponder, in symbols per second.
A symbol is a pulse in digital baseband transmission.

high_band.description: Whether high frequency band is used.

polarization.description:
Polarization of the transponder for this channel. 
The supported values are: 

 * `v`- vertical linear polarization, 
 * `h` - horizontal linear polarization, 
 * `r` - right-hand circular polarization, 
 * `l` - left-hand circular polarization.

guard_interval.description: The mode of inserting a guard interval - a padding separating transmissions so that they do not interfere with each other.

pilot.description: Enable, disable, or autodetect pilot tones.

rolloff.description:
Rolloff factor, in %.
It is used to estimate bandwidth, together with symbol rate.

disabled.description: Whether this DVB card is disabled.

stats.description: Statistic information about the captured signal.

serial.description: Serial number of the card, used for capturing from DekTec ASI cards.

port.description: Port number, used for capturing from DekTec ASI cards.

record_input.description: Configuration of DVB input recording as-is.

compensate_time_drift_ppm.description: Max source's internal clock drift to compensate, rounding to six decimal places.

plp_stream_id.description: PLP stream selector. Used in DVB-T2.

attenuator.description: Attenuation of the signal level. Takes values from 0 to 10.

interleave.description:
Use interleaver.
The interlaver disperses sequence of bits in bit stream to minimize effect of burst errors during transmission.

gain.description: Adjust the output gain to the specified value in dB.

video_device.description:
The video device to capture video from Stream Labs SDI/ASI cards.
It is actually a path to a device file created on the disk by Video4Linux.

ber.description: Bit error rate. It is the percent of bit errors from total number of transferred bits.

strength_raw.description: Signal strength, as a raw 16-bit number received from DVB API.

snr_raw.description: Signal-noise ratio, as a raw 16-bit number received from DVB API. It is the ratio of signal power to the noise power.

snr.description: Signal-noise ratio, in percent. It is the ratio of signal power to the noise power.

has_signal.description: Whether a signal is detected above the normal noise level.

has_viterbi.description: DVB signal was locked at Viterbi decoder stage.

has_timedout.description: The signal was not locked within the last about 2 seconds.

has_reinit.description: The frontend was reinitialized, the application is recommended to reset DiSEqC, tone and parameters.

has_rate.description: Input rate is sufficient (900 bps or greater). Used for capturing from DekTec ASI cards.

additionalProperties.description:
A set of filters for event fields.
You can specify an event field and its possible values.

url.description:
Path where events are sent.

* For event handler, it is the URL of an HTTP handler or the path to a lua script:  `http://URL`, `https://URL`, or `path_to_lua_script.lua`.
* For event logging, it is the path to a log file (human-readable text file or JSON): `log://path_to_log_file.log` or `jsonlog://path_to_log_file.json`.

buffer.description:
If this option is enabled, Flussonic accumulates events in a special buffer.
If the receiving HTTP server or script does not respond, then Flussonic periodically retries sending them untill it gets the respond.

only.description:
If specified, only the events that match **every** filter in the filter set will be passed to the event sink target.

That is, if even one of the conditions is not satisfied, an event will **not** be processed. 
Each filter (condition) has several possible values. For an event to satisfy the condition, 
an event should match **any** of the specified values, not all of them.

except.description:
If specified, only the events that match **every** filter in the filter set will not be be passed to the event sink target.

That is, if even one of the conditions is not satisfied, an event will be processed.

Each filter (condition) has several possible values. For an event to satisfy the condition, 
an event should match **any** of the specified values, not all of them.

throttle_delay.description:
The delay (in seconds) before sending an event to the sink after saving it into the buffer. 
This parameter allows to lower frequency of sending events.

If there are more than 100 events in the buffer, all of them will be sent to the sink without any delay.

max_size.description:
Maximum size of a log file. 

When this limit is reached, log rotation is performed: the oldest events will be overridden by later data.

max_depth.description:
Maximal number of log files with events (JSON or text) that can be stored on a disk.

When this limit is reached, log rotation is performed: the oldest files will be overridden by later data.

resend_limit.description:
If an error occurs (`HTTP 500` or any other error), then *Flussonic* will try to buffer events and send them later.

The option defines the **number** of events to keep in memory for further delivery.

The default value is `unlimited`.

resend_timeout.description: How often *Flussonic* will try to resend non-confirmed events to the handler (in seconds).

resend_notifications_limit.description: Maximum number of events in a buffer accumulated when the event handler does not respond.

resend_notifications_timeout.description: Timeout for attempts to resend events accumulated when the event handler did not respond.

verbose.description: The level of logging according to event importance.

level.description: Specify logging level for this sink. Anything more verbose than it will not get into this sink.

utc_ms.description: The time of the event registration on the server.

media.description: The name of the stream or file where the event was captured.

submedia.description: Some additional info on the media, may vary depending on the media type.

referer.description: Referer HTTP header or its analog for other protocols.

user_agent.description: Client's user agent for selected protocol.
user_agent.example: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML. like Gecko) Chrome/90.0.4430.72 Safari/537.36

query_string.description: Full query string of initial request of the session.

country.description: The country determined from the user's IP address.

user_id.description: User ID provided by the authorization backend like Middleware, your billing, or web portal.

path.description: The path to the advertising file in a VOD location.

midroll_insert_by.description:
When to perform midrolls.
If your stream has SCTE35 or SCTE104 you may opt to use them.
By default ads are inserted on regular intervals

session_id.description: Unique identifier (or UUID) of the session.

event.description: Pid is added to the output multiplexed stream
Pid is dropped from the output multiplexed stream

url.description: The URL of an HTTP backend.

allow_tokens.description: Explicit list of tokens that give access to the content without any other checks.

deny_tokens.description: Explicit list of tokens that deny access to the content and stop any other checks.

allow_ips.description: Explicit list of IP-addresses or subnet masks that have access to the content without any other checks.

deny_ips.description: Explicit list of IP-addresses or subnet masks that are banned from accessing the content.

allow_countries.description:
Explicit list of countries (two-letter country codes according to ISO 3166-1) that have access to the content without any other checks.
Flussonic uses the MaxMind GeoLite2 Country database to map a country to a block of IP addresses. 
New releases of GeoIP2 databases come out more often than the releases of Flussonic server, so sometimes the used database can become outdated.
Therefore we recommend you to install a separate GeoIP2 library and set up Flussonic to use it.

deny_countries.description:
Explicit list of countries (two-letter country codes according to ISO 3166-1) that are banned from accessing the content.
Flussonic uses the MaxMind GeoLite2 Country database to map a country to a block of IP addresses. 
New releases of GeoIP2 databases come out more often than the releases of Flussonic server, so sometimes the used database can become outdated.
Therefore we recommend you to install a separate GeoIP2 library and set up Flussonic to use it.

allow_uas.description: Explicit list of user agents (set-top boxes or browsers) that have access to the content without any other checks.

deny_uas.description: The list of user agents (set-top boxes or browsers) that are banned from accessing the content.

allow_default.description:
This option defines the default behavior in the case when all backends are not responding (usually, because of errors in HTTP responses) and the session is not started yet.
If this option is enabled, all clients or devices except those listed in `deny` option will have access to the content.
If this option is disabled, all clients or devices except those listed in `allow` option will not have access to the content.

path.description: The path where the files from the cloud or HTTP are cached to speed up broadcasting.

misses.description: The number of requests necessary for a file to be cached.

storage_limit.description:
Maximum disk consumption in bytes. 
When this limit is reached, the oldest files will be overridden by later files.

expiration.description:
A period (in seconds) back from the current moment during which the files are stored.
As time goes, the files which are older than this period are being overridden by the later files.

disk_limit.description:
Maximum disk consumption in bytes. 
When this limit is reached, the oldest files will be overridden by later files.

time_limit.description:
A period (in seconds) back from the current moment during which the files are stored.
As time goes, the files which are older than this period are being overridden by the later files.

prefix.description: HTTP prefix that will be intercepted by this http proxy configuration

mainpage.description: If this flag is set, then streamer will redirect from "/" to this proxy configuration.

api_port.description: Private port for API requests to the chassis from coders.

auto_reboot.description: Shows if auto restart of coders when (re)starting chassis is enabled.

dhcpd_iface.description:
Network interface for automatic reception of IP address from DHCP server. 
This interface will be used for launching coders.

lcd.description: Shows if LCD monitor capabilities are enabled in the firmware.

tftp_port.description: Port for TFTP used for loading program core to the coders.

update_channel.description: Update channel specified in the config file.

firmware_version.description: Firmware version installed on the device.

firmware_boot_dir.description: Directory to boot the device from. This is also where the firmware is downloaded on updates.

hostname.description: The name of the chassis server.

default_gateway_interface.description:
If `default_gateway` parameters are set the individual interfaces config, 
this gateway is only used for checking license and updates. 
Otherwise, it is used as gateway for all traffic.

version.description: Full version number of the firmware.

next_version.description: The latest available version of the firmware, if any.

serial_number.description: The serial number of the chassis.

hardware_id.description: MAC address of the manage0 interface.

leases.description: The list of leased IP addresses.

file_count.description: The number of files sent over TFTP.

sent_bytes.description: The number of bytes sent over TFTP.

port.description: The port used for NTP daemon.

config.description: Partial configuration that can be recovered if an error occurs.

line.description: Line number pointing to where an error was detected.

first_error_line.description: If an error takes up to several lines, it is the first line where the error was detected.

col.description: The column number pointing to where the error was detected.

path.description: Config path to the erroneous element.

detail.description: Some other details that may help to identify the error.

total_mb.description: Total number of megabytes shown by the OS for this partition.

usage.description: Percentage of usage of this partition.

server_version.description: Package version of the server. Might be simple a number of release like 21.11 or longer if you have a rolling release installed.

config_version.description:
Current runtime version of config. We do not declare exact structure, but we promise
that it will be always comparable and increasing (if server has proper NTP configuration, of course).
Right now it is a tuple of server start time and incrementing version of config.

next_version.description: Notification about a newer version in the repository.

streamer_status.description:
*Flussonic* will always try to start even if there are severe errors that do not
allow functioning.

`starting` status means you should wait for some time (not more than
a minute).

`running` status means all configuration was loaded. However, the status does not provide
an information about your streams and the quality of provided service.

All other statuses mean there are some severe problems on the server
that cannot be repaired by Flussonic itself.

hostname.description: Hostname of your server. Please, use FQDN, do not leave your Linux misconfigured.

license_txt.description: The code of the license applied on the server.

id.description: Unique runtime ID of this instance. Updated with the restart.

vsaas.description: Shows if Flussonic Watcher is enabled in the license.

vsaas_branding.description: Shows if Watcher branding is enabled in the license.

vsaas_running.description: Shows if Watcher is currently running.

transcoder.description:
Shows if the server's CPU can be used for transcoding 
(i.e. if the `flussonic-transcoder` package is installed on the server).

bandwidth_usage.description: Outbound bandwidth usage (load balancing in `usage` mode is based on this value).

partitions.description: The list of disk partitions on the server.

transcoder_devices.description: Statistics on the devices used for transcoding.

text_alerts.description:
Human-readable format of errors and alerts that need to be fixed. 
Provided by some *Flussonic* subsystems.

config_error.description: Information about errors in the config file.

is_chassis.description: The flag shows if Flussonic runs on Flussonic Coder.

total_clients.description: The number of clients receiving the streams from the server at the moment of request.

total_streams.description: The number of streams created on the server.

online_streams.description: The number of streams that are ready to be served to the clients.

http.description: List of HTTP ports or `host:port` pairs that will be used for listening. Deprecated, use listeners object.

https.description: List of HTTP ports or `host:port` pairs specs provided that you have valid certificate and domain name. Deprecated, use listeners object.

admin_http.description: Enable another port for API calls. If enabled, `http` port is **not** used for API calls. Deprecated, use listeners object.

admin_https.description: Enable `admin_https` port for API calls. Deprecated, use listeners object.

rtsps.description: RTSP(S) listening port. Not a standard thing, but *ffmpeg* can connect to RTSP using SSL.

turn.description: TURN port for your WebRTC installation.

srt.description:
Global SRT listening port. It is possible to use a single port for playback and publishing, but it is not compatible with clients.
Consider configuring separate ports for playback and publishing for each stream.

srt2.description:
Global SRT2 listening port. It is not possible to use a single port for playback and publishing.
Configure separate ports for playback and publishing for each stream.

srt_play.description: SRT play configuration with single-port mode. Not supported by many clients, better use per-stream mode.

srt2_play.description: SRT2 play configuration with single-port mode. Not supported by many clients, better use per-stream mode.

srt_publish.description: SRT publish configuration with single-port mode. Not supported by many clients, better use per-stream mode.

srt2_publish.description: SRT2 publish configuration with single-port mode. Not supported by many clients, better use per-stream mode.

meta.description: Some additional options of the server.

loglevel.description: Raise loglevel to debug if needed.

nvidia_monitor.description: Enables saving statistics on Nvidia performance.

log_requests.description: Enables logging of requests for streams (manifests, segments) and API request.

session_log.description: Directory to store the session log.

cluster_key.description: The cluster key to unite several servers with the same key into a cluster.

url_prefix.description:
This option applies to HLS and DASH protocols, for all streams on the server. 
The addresses of individual segments within a segment-based playlist will start with the specified prefix.
This setting is available in the global part of the config file as well as locally for any individual stream. 
When specified at the stream level, it is only valid for this particular stream.

view_auth.description: Credentials for access to readonly API functions like getting streams info, status, and statistics.

edit_auth.description: Credentials for administrator access to the server.

api_allowed_from.description: The list of allowed subnets to accept API requests from.

auth_token.description: Configure key name of query string key-value pair for token authentication

peers.description: The configuration of peers in the cluster.

sources.description: The configuration of the video sources.

dvb_cards.description: The configuration of the DVB cards.

camera_alarm.description: The configuration of the camera alarms.

rproxy.description: The configuration of the port forwarding.

vsaas.description: The configuration of the video surveillance subsystem.

get.description:
This API method is one of the most important in whole API, because it gives the list of all streams,
including:

* configured (may not be running at the moment)
* running (including those that are created via a template and do not have own disk configuration)
* remote (available from other servers)
* only recorded

Together with the `stream_save` method you can manage streams in Flussonic.

You can pass all stream configuration options to query string for filtering, not only specified in the parameters.

This method and `stream_get` will return `effective stream configuration` with all templates, overrides, defaults
included into this response. It is not exactly what you can see in the disk config. If you have configured
this stream in the disk file, then the original disk configuration can be found in the field `config_on_disk`.

What you get from this API call is not what you write to `stream_save`.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields (including nested) that will be returned.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Composite sort direction.
Default sort order is `named_by (config,user,remote)`, `position`, `name`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit select count in collection to N elements.  Default value is 100.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description:
Properly encoded analog of offset, allowing to read next bunch of items. 
We do not offer common `offset` fields, use please cursor for predictable
fetching of quickly changing list of items. More information can be found [here](https://flussonic.com/doc/api/flussonic-http-api/#limited-collections-access-cursors)

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search pattern for different fields like name, title, urls, etc.

get.description: This method allows to fetch a single stream. Refer to the `streams_list` operation to find out what data will be returned in this method.

parameters.description: Stream name.
parameters.name: name

put.description:
Create or update a stream by its name.
If the stream doesn't exists in the disk config, it will be created.

If you try to update a stream that is started from a template by a user request
having `named_by=user`, a new stream will be created in the disk config.

If you pass only a partial stream configuration, this field will be updated, not the whole stream.

To create a new stream the property `name` is required.

Pass the `"$reset": true` option to replace the stream configuration with the provided one.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: stream name

parameters.name: part
parameters.description:
The stream is configured by several origins of configuration. It may be `config_on_disk`
or temporary runtime `config_override` that can be provided via `on_play` or `on_publish`
backend, or edited via this API call if you pass `config_override` to this parameter.

delete.description:
This method allows to delete a single stream. You can delete `config_override` by this API call if you want
to remove all runtime overrides.

If you do not specify any `part` parameter, this stream will be deleted from `config_on_disk`
and if it was `named_by: config`, then it will immediately stop.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: stream name

parameters.name: part
parameters.description: part of config to delete

post.description:
Stop the stream with a specified name.

If the stream is static, it will restart according to existing rules.

This API call is a replacement for both: stop and restart.

Server cannot restart a stream that was started by user (publish for example),
because it cannot ask user to repeat publishing.

Static stream declared in config will be started automatically as if it failed
due to any bug.

This is why `restart` is actually a `stop` and maybe `start`, while `start` is made
by live stream subsystem

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Stream name.
Stream name.
parameters.name: name

get.description:
This method allows to get the list of all event sinks (former `notify`) configured in Flussonic.

Each event sink is an instruction for Flussonic to send events to some target. 
In particular, you can configure sending events to an event handler or writing them to a log file.

Event sink has its unique name just for management purposes,
event filtering instructions and target for sending events.

tags.name: iptv
tags.description:
Manage trivial middleware with user management and channel permissions.
Use players like Kodi to get access to per-user playlists.

It is very trivial, just for very trivial operations like giving someone a static
token for accessing content.

Database is a static JSON file on disk that is overwritten on each update.
